filename.description: Path to file to write to.

ca_certificate_path.description: Path to server's CA certificate for verification of HTTPS communications

client_certificate_path.descritption: Path to client's CA certificate for HTTPS communications

max_threads.description: Experimental: Max parallelism for REST API calls

retry_status_codes.description: Retry HTTP request also on these status codes

extra_headers.description: Extra headers which will be added to the request.

disable_ssl_verification.description: Disable SSL verification for HTTPS communications.

schema_registry_url.description: URL of schema registry being used.

MetadataChangeEvent.description: Overridden Kafka topic name for the MetadataChangeEvent

MetadataChangeProposal.description: Overridden Kafka topic name for the MetadataChangeProposal

okta_config.title: OktaConfig
okta_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

okta_domain.title: Okta Domain
okta_domain.description: The location of your Okta Domain, without a protocol. Can be found in Okta Developer console. e.g. dev-33231928.okta.com

okta_api_token.title: Okta Api Token
okta_api_token.description: An API token generated for the DataHub application inside your Okta Developer Console. e.g. 00be4R_M2MzDqXawbWgfKGpKee0kuEOfX1RCQSRx00

ingest_users.title: Ingest Users
ingest_users.description: Whether users should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_groups.title: Ingest Groups
ingest_groups.description: Whether groups should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_group_membership.title: Ingest Group Membership
ingest_group_membership.description: Whether group membership should be ingested into DataHub. ingest_groups must be True if this is True.

okta_profile_to_username_attr.title: Okta Profile To Username Attr
okta_profile_to_username_attr.description: Which Okta User Profile attribute to use as input to DataHub username mapping. Common values used are - login, email.

okta_profile_to_username_regex.title: Okta Profile To Username Regex
okta_profile_to_username_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub username from the attribute specified in `okta_profile_to_username_attr`.

okta_profile_to_group_name_attr.title: Okta Profile To Group Name Attr
okta_profile_to_group_name_attr.description: Which Okta Group Profile attribute to use as input to DataHub group name mapping.

okta_profile_to_group_name_regex.title: Okta Profile To Group Name Regex
okta_profile_to_group_name_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub group name from the attribute specified in `okta_profile_to_group_name_attr`.

include_deprovisioned_users.title: Include Deprovisioned Users
include_deprovisioned_users.description: Whether to ingest users in the DEPROVISIONED state from Okta.

include_suspended_users.title: Include Suspended Users
include_suspended_users.description: Whether to ingest users in the SUSPENDED state from Okta.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: The number of entities requested from Okta's REST APIs in one request.

delay_seconds.title: Delay Seconds
delay_seconds.description: Number of seconds to wait between calls to Okta's REST APIs. (Okta rate limits). Defaults to 10ms.

okta_users_filter.title: Okta Users Filter
okta_users_filter.description: Okta filter expression (not regex) for ingesting users. Only one of `okta_users_filter` and `okta_users_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/#list-users-with-a-filter) for more info.

okta_users_search.title: Okta Users Search
okta_users_search.description: Okta search expression (not regex) for ingesting users. Only one of `okta_users_filter` and `okta_users_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/#list-users-with-search) for more info.

okta_groups_filter.title: Okta Groups Filter
okta_groups_filter.description: Okta filter expression (not regex) for ingesting groups. Only one of `okta_groups_filter` and `okta_groups_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/groups/#filters) for more info.

okta_groups_search.title: Okta Groups Search
okta_groups_search.description: Okta search expression (not regex) for ingesting groups. Only one of `okta_groups_filter` and `okta_groups_search` can be set. See (https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/groups/#list-groups-with-search) for more info.

skip_users_without_a_group.title: Skip Users Without A Group
skip_users_without_a_group.description: Whether to only ingest users that are members of groups. If this is set to False, all users will be ingested regardless of group membership.

cockroachdb_config.title: CockroachDBConfig
cockroachdb_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs. To set connection arguments in the URL, specify them under `connect_args`.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: Populates view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

database.title: Database
database.description: database (catalog). If set to Null, all databases will be considered for ingestion.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

database_pattern.title: Database Pattern
database_pattern.description: Regex patterns for databases to filter in ingestion. Note: this is not used if `database` or `sqlalchemy_uri` are provided.

initial_database.title: Initial Database
initial_database.description: Initial database used to query for the list of databases, when ingesting multiple databases. Note: this is not used if `database` or `sqlalchemy_uri` are provided.

sql-queries_config.title: SqlQueriesSourceConfig
sql-queries_config.description: Any source that connects to a platform should inherit this class

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

platform.title: Platform
platform.description: The platform for which to generate data, e.g. snowflake

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: The usage config to use when generating usage statistics

default_db.title: Default Db
default_db.description: The default database to use for unqualified table names

default_schema.title: Default Schema
default_schema.description: The default schema to use for unqualified table names

default_dialect.title: Default Dialect
default_dialect.description: The SQL dialect to use when parsing queries. Overrides automatic dialect detection.

bigquery_config.title: BigQueryV2Config
bigquery_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

enable_stateful_profiling.title: Enable Stateful Profiling
enable_stateful_profiling.description: Enable stateful profiling. This will store profiling timestamps per dataset after successful profiling. and will not run profiling again in subsequent run if table has not been updated.

enable_stateful_lineage_ingestion.title: Enable Stateful Lineage Ingestion
enable_stateful_lineage_ingestion.description: Enable stateful lineage ingestion. This will store lineage window timestamps after successful lineage ingestion. and will not run lineage ingestion for same timestamps in subsequent run.

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`). You can also specify relative time with respect to end_time such as '-7 days' Or '-7d'.

enable_stateful_usage_ingestion.title: Enable Stateful Usage Ingestion
enable_stateful_usage_ingestion.description: Enable stateful lineage ingestion. This will store usage window timestamps after successful usage ingestion. and will not run usage ingestion for same timestamps in subsequent run.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

include_data_platform_instance.title: Include Data Platform Instance
include_data_platform_instance.description: Whether to create a DataPlatformInstance aspect, equal to the BigQuery project id. If enabled, will cause redundancy in the browse path for BigQuery entities in the UI, because the project id is represented as the top-level container.

enable_legacy_sharded_table_support.title: Enable Legacy Sharded Table Support
enable_legacy_sharded_table_support.description: Use the legacy sharded table urn suffix added.

project_ids.title: Project Ids
project_ids.description: Ingests specified project_ids. Use this property if you want to specify what projects to ingest or don't want to give project resourcemanager.projects.list to your service account. Overrides `project_id_pattern`.

project_labels.title: Project Labels
project_labels.description: Ingests projects with the specified labels. Set value in the format of `key:value`. Use this property to define which projects to ingest basedon project-level labels. If project_ids or project_id is set, this configuration has no effect. The ingestion process filters projects by label first, and then applies the project_id_pattern.

project_id_pattern.title: Project Id Pattern
project_id_pattern.description: Regex patterns for project_id to filter in ingestion.

dataset_pattern.title: Dataset Pattern
dataset_pattern.description: Regex patterns for dataset to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

match_fully_qualified_names.title: Match Fully Qualified Names
match_fully_qualified_names.description: [deprecated] Whether `dataset_pattern` is matched against fully qualified dataset name `<project_id>.<dataset_name>`.

table_snapshot_pattern.title: Table Snapshot Pattern
table_snapshot_pattern.description: Regex patterns for table snapshots to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire snapshot name in database.schema.snapshot format. e.g. to match all snapshots starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

rate_limit.title: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: Should we rate limit requests made to API.

requests_per_min.title: Requests Per Min
requests_per_min.description: Used to control number of API calls made per min. Only used when `rate_limit` is set to `True`.

temp_table_dataset_prefix.title: Temp Table Dataset Prefix
temp_table_dataset_prefix.description: If you are creating temp tables in a dataset with a particular prefix you can use this config to set the prefix for the dataset. This is to support workflows from before bigquery's introduction of temp tables. By default we use `_` because of datasets that begin with an underscore are hidden by default https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/datasets#dataset-naming.

sharded_table_pattern.title: Sharded Table Pattern
sharded_table_pattern.description: The regex pattern to match sharded tables and group as one table. This is a very low level config parameter, only change if you know what you are doing,

extra_client_options.title: Extra Client Options
extra_client_options.description: Additional options to pass to google.cloud.logging_v2.client.Client.

project_on_behalf.title: Project On Behalf
project_on_behalf.description: [Advanced] The BigQuery project in which queries are executed. Will be passed when creating a job. If not passed, falls back to the project associated with the service account.

include_schema_metadata.title: Include Schema Metadata
include_schema_metadata.description: Whether to ingest the BigQuery schema, i.e. projects, schemas, tables, and views.

capture_table_label_as_tag.title: Capture Table Label As Tag
capture_table_label_as_tag.description: Capture BigQuery table labels as DataHub tag

capture_view_label_as_tag.title: Capture View Label As Tag
capture_view_label_as_tag.description: Capture BigQuery view labels as DataHub tag

capture_dataset_label_as_tag.title: Capture Dataset Label As Tag
capture_dataset_label_as_tag.description: Capture BigQuery dataset labels as DataHub tag

include_external_url.title: Include External Url
include_external_url.description: Whether to populate BigQuery Console url to Datasets/Tables

include_table_snapshots.title: Include Table Snapshots
include_table_snapshots.description: Whether table snapshots should be ingested.

debug_include_full_payloads.title: Debug Include Full Payloads
debug_include_full_payloads.description: Include full payload into events. It is only for debugging and internal use.

number_of_datasets_process_in_batch_if_p.title: Number Of Datasets Process In Batch If Profiling Enabled
number_of_datasets_process_in_batch_if_p.description: Number of partitioned table queried in batch when getting metadata. This is a low level config property which should be touched with care. This restriction is needed because we query partitions system view which throws error if we try to touch too many tables.

use_tables_list_query_v2.title: Use Tables List Query V2
use_tables_list_query_v2.description: List tables using an improved query that extracts partitions and last modified timestamps more accurately. Requires the ability to read table data. Automatically enabled when profiling is enabled.

use_queries_v2.title: Use Queries V2
use_queries_v2.description: If enabled, uses the new queries extractor to extract queries from bigquery.

column_limit.title: Column Limit
column_limit.description: Maximum number of columns to process in a table. This is a low level config property which should be touched with care. This restriction is needed because excessively wide tables can result in failure to ingest the schema.

lineage_use_sql_parser.title: Lineage Use Sql Parser
lineage_use_sql_parser.description: Use sql parser to resolve view/table lineage.

lineage_parse_view_ddl.title: Lineage Parse View Ddl
lineage_parse_view_ddl.description: Sql parse view ddl to get lineage.

lineage_sql_parser_use_raw_names.title: Lineage Sql Parser Use Raw Names
lineage_sql_parser_use_raw_names.description: This parameter ignores the lowercase pattern stipulated in the SQLParser. NOTE: Ignored if lineage_use_sql_parser is False.

extract_column_lineage.title: Extract Column Lineage
extract_column_lineage.description: If enabled, generate column level lineage. Requires lineage_use_sql_parser to be enabled.

extract_lineage_from_catalog.title: Extract Lineage From Catalog
extract_lineage_from_catalog.description: This flag enables the data lineage extraction from Data Lineage API exposed by Google Data Catalog. NOTE: This extractor can't build views lineage. It's recommended to enable the view's DDL parsing. Read the docs to have more information about: https://cloud.google.com/data-catalog/docs/concepts/about-data-lineage

extract_policy_tags_from_catalog.title: Extract Policy Tags From Catalog
extract_policy_tags_from_catalog.description: This flag enables the extraction of policy tags from the Google Data Catalog API. When enabled, the extractor will fetch policy tags associated with BigQuery table columns. For more information about policy tags and column-level security, refer to the documentation: https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/column-level-security-intro

log_page_size.title: Log Page Size
log_page_size.description: The number of log item will be queried per page for lineage collection

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: Option to enable/disable lineage generation. Is enabled by default.

max_query_duration.title: Max Query Duration
max_query_duration.description: Correction to pad start_time and end_time with. For handling the case where the read happens within our time range but the query completion event is delayed and happens after the configured end time.

bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.title: Bigquery Audit Metadata Datasets
bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets.description: A list of datasets that contain a table named cloudaudit_googleapis_com_data_access which contain BigQuery audit logs, specifically, those containing BigQueryAuditMetadata. It is recommended that the project of the dataset is also specified, for example, projectA.datasetB.

use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.title: Use Exported Bigquery Audit Metadata
use_exported_bigquery_audit_metadata.description: When configured, use BigQueryAuditMetadata in bigquery_audit_metadata_datasets to compute lineage information.

use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.title: Use Date Sharded Audit Log Tables
use_date_sharded_audit_log_tables.description: Whether to read date sharded tables or time partitioned tables when extracting usage from exported audit logs.

upstream_lineage_in_report.title: Upstream Lineage In Report
upstream_lineage_in_report.description: Useful for debugging lineage information. Set to True to see the raw lineage created internally.

exclude_empty_projects.title: Exclude Empty Projects
exclude_empty_projects.description: Option to exclude empty projects from being ingested.

schema_resolution_batch_size.title: Schema Resolution Batch Size
schema_resolution_batch_size.description: The number of tables to process in a batch when resolving schema from DataHub.

max_threads_dataset_parallelism.title: Max Threads Dataset Parallelism
max_threads_dataset_parallelism.description: Number of worker threads to use to parallelize BigQuery Dataset Metadata Extraction. Set to 1 to disable.

teradata_config.title: TeradataConfig
teradata_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`). You can also specify relative time with respect to end_time such as '-7 days' Or '-7d'.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs. To set connection arguments in the URL, specify them under `connect_args`.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: Whether to include view lineage in the ingestion. This requires to have the view lineage feature enabled.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

database_pattern.title: Database Pattern
database_pattern.description: Regex patterns for databases to filter in ingestion.

databases.title: Databases
databases.description: List of databases to ingest. If not specified, all databases will be ingested. Even if this is specified, databases will still be filtered by `database_pattern`.

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: The usage config to use when generating usage statistics

default_db.title: Default Db
default_db.description: The default database to use for unqualified table names

use_qvci.title: Use Qvci
use_qvci.description: Whether to use QVCI to get column information. This is faster but requires to have QVCI enabled.

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: Whether to include table lineage in the ingestion. This requires to have the table lineage feature enabled.

powerbi_config.title: PowerBiDashboardSourceConfig
powerbi_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to

workspace_id_pattern.title: Workspace Id Pattern
workspace_id_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter PowerBI workspaces in ingestion

server_to_platform_instance.title: Server To Platform Instance
server_to_platform_instance.description: A mapping of PowerBI datasource's server i.e host[:port] to Data platform instance. :port is optional and only needed if your datasource server is running on non-standard port. For Google BigQuery the datasource's server is google bigquery project name. For Databricks Unity Catalog the datasource's server is workspace FQDN.

scan_batch_size.title: Scan Batch Size
scan_batch_size.description: batch size for sending workspace_ids to PBI, 100 is the limit

workspace_id_as_urn_part.title: Workspace Id As Urn Part
workspace_id_as_urn_part.description: Highly recommend changing this to True, as you can have the same workspace nameTo maintain backward compatability, this is set to False which uses workspace name

extract_ownership.title: Extract Ownership
extract_ownership.description: Whether ownership should be ingested. Admin API access is required if this setting is enabled. Note that enabling this may overwrite owners that you've added inside DataHub's web application.

modified_since.title: Modified Since
modified_since.description: Get only recently modified workspaces based on modified_since datetime '2023-02-10T00:00:00.0000000Z', excludePersonalWorkspaces and excludeInActiveWorkspaces limit to last 30 days

extract_dashboards.title: Extract Dashboards
extract_dashboards.description: Whether to ingest PBI Dashboard and Tiles as Datahub Dashboard and Chart

extract_dataset_schema.title: Extract Dataset Schema
extract_dataset_schema.description: Whether to ingest PBI Dataset Table columns and measures

extract_lineage.title: Extract Lineage
extract_lineage.description: Whether lineage should be ingested between X and Y. Admin API access is required if this setting is enabled

extract_endorsements_to_tags.title: Extract Endorsements To Tags
extract_endorsements_to_tags.description: Whether to extract endorsements to tags, note that this may overwrite existing tags. Admin API access is required is this setting is enabled

filter_dataset_endorsements.title: Filter Dataset Endorsements
filter_dataset_endorsements.description: Filter and ingest datasets which are 'Certified' or 'Promoted' endorsement. If both are added, dataset which are 'Certified' or 'Promoted' will be ingested . Default setting allows all dataset to be ingested

extract_datasets_to_containers.title: Extract Datasets To Containers
extract_datasets_to_containers.description: PBI tables will be grouped under a Datahub Container, the container reflect a PBI Dataset

native_query_parsing.title: Native Query Parsing
native_query_parsing.description: Whether PowerBI native query should be parsed to extract lineage

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert the PowerBI assets urns to lowercase

convert_lineage_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Lineage Urns To Lowercase
convert_lineage_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert the urns of ingested lineage dataset to lowercase

admin_apis_only.title: Admin Apis Only
admin_apis_only.description: Retrieve metadata using PowerBI Admin API only. If this is enabled, then Report Pages will not be extracted. Admin API access is required if this setting is enabled

extract_independent_datasets.title: Extract Independent Datasets
extract_independent_datasets.description: Whether to extract datasets not used in any PowerBI visualization

enable_advance_lineage_sql_construct.title: Enable Advance Lineage Sql Construct
enable_advance_lineage_sql_construct.description: Whether to enable advance native sql construct for parsing like join, sub-queries. along this flag , the native_query_parsing should be enabled. By default convert_lineage_urns_to_lowercase is enabled, in-case if you have disabled it in previous ingestion execution then it may break lineageas this option generates the upstream datasets URN in lowercase.

extract_column_level_lineage.title: Extract Column Level Lineage
extract_column_level_lineage.description: Whether to extract column level lineage. Works only if configs `native_query_parsing`, `enable_advance_lineage_sql_construct` & `extract_lineage` are enabled.Works for M-Query where native SQL is used for transformation.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered. Matched format is 'workspacename.datasetname.tablename'

pulsar_config.title: PulsarSourceConfig
pulsar_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

web_service_url.title: Web Service Url
web_service_url.description: The web URL for the cluster.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Timout setting, how long to wait for the Pulsar rest api to send data before giving up

issuer_url.title: Issuer Url
issuer_url.description: The complete URL for a Custom Authorization Server. Mandatory for OAuth based authentication.

token.title: Token
token.description: The access token for the application. Mandatory for token based authentication.

verify_ssl.title: Verify Ssl
verify_ssl.description: Either a boolean, in which case it controls whether we verify the server's TLS certificate, or a string, in which case it must be a path to a CA bundle to use.

tenant_patterns.title: Tenant Patterns
tenant_patterns.description: List of regex patterns for tenants to include/exclude from ingestion. By default all tenants are allowed.

namespace_patterns.title: Namespace Patterns
namespace_patterns.description: List of regex patterns for namespaces to include/exclude from ingestion. By default the functions namespace is denied.

topic_patterns.title: Topic Patterns
topic_patterns.description: List of regex patterns for topics to include/exclude from ingestion. By default the Pulsar system topics are denied.

exclude_individual_partitions.title: Exclude Individual Partitions
exclude_individual_partitions.description: Extract each individual partitioned topic. e.g. when turned off a topic with 100 partitions will result in 100 Datasets.

tenants.title: Tenants
tenants.description: Listing all tenants requires superUser role, alternative you can set a list of tenants you want to scrape using the tenant admin role

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Domain patterns

tableau_config.title: TableauConfig
tableau_config.description:
Any non-Dataset source that produces lineage to Datasets should inherit this class.
e.g. Orchestrators, Pipelines, BI Tools etc.

username.title: Username
username.description: Tableau username, must be set if authenticating using username/password.

password.title: Password
password.description: Tableau password, must be set if authenticating using username/password.

token_name.title: Token Name
token_name.description: Tableau token name, must be set if authenticating using a personal access token.

token_value.title: Token Value
token_value.description: Tableau token value, must be set if authenticating using a personal access token.

site.title: Site
site.description: Tableau Site. Always required for Tableau Online. Use emptystring to connect with Default site on Tableau Server.

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

max_retries.title: Max Retries
max_retries.description: Number of retries for failed requests.

ssl_verify.title: Ssl Verify
ssl_verify.description: Whether to verify SSL certificates. If using self-signed certificates, set to false or provide the path to the .pem certificate bundle.

extract_column_level_lineage.title: Extract Column Level Lineage
extract_column_level_lineage.description: When enabled, extracts column-level lineage from Tableau Datasources

env.title: Env
env.description: Environment to use in namespace when constructing URNs.

platform_instance_map.title: Platform Instance Map
platform_instance_map.description: A holder for platform -> platform_instance mappings to generate correct dataset urns

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: [deprecated] Use project_pattern instead. List of tableau projects

project_pattern.title: Project Pattern
project_pattern.description: Filter for specific Tableau projects. For example, use 'My Project' to ingest a root-level Project with name 'My Project', or 'My Project/Nested Project' to ingest a nested Project with name 'Nested Project'. By default, all Projects nested inside a matching Project will be included in ingestion. You can both allow and deny projects based on their name using their name, or a Regex pattern. Deny patterns always take precedence over allow patterns. By default, all projects will be ingested.

project_path_separator.title: Project Path Separator
project_path_separator.description: The separator used for the project_pattern field between project names. By default, we use a slash. You can change this if your Tableau projects contain slashes in their names, and you'd like to filter by project.

default_schema_map.title: Default Schema Map
default_schema_map.description: Default schema to use when schema is not found.

ingest_tags.title: Ingest Tags
ingest_tags.description: Ingest Tags from source. This will override Tags entered from UI

ingest_owner.title: Ingest Owner
ingest_owner.description: Ingest Owner from source. This will override Owner info entered from UI

ingest_tables_external.title: Ingest Tables External
ingest_tables_external.description: Ingest details for tables external to (not embedded in) tableau as entities.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: [advanced] Number of metadata objects (e.g. CustomSQLTable, PublishedDatasource, etc) to query at a time using the Tableau API.

fetch_size.title: Fetch Size
fetch_size.description: Specifies the number of records to retrieve in each batch during a query execution.

workbook_page_size.title: Workbook Page Size
workbook_page_size.description: [advanced] Number of workbooks to query at a time using the Tableau API.

lineage_overrides.title: Lineage Overrides
lineage_overrides.description: Mappings to change generated dataset urns. Use only if you really know what you are doing.

database_hostname_to_platform_instance_m.title: Database Hostname To Platform Instance Map
database_hostname_to_platform_instance_m.description: Mappings to change platform instance in generated dataset urns based on database. Use only if you really know what you are doing.

extract_usage_stats.title: Extract Usage Stats
extract_usage_stats.description: [experimental] Extract usage statistics for dashboards and charts.

ingest_embed_url.title: Ingest Embed Url
ingest_embed_url.description: Ingest a URL to render an embedded Preview of assets within Tableau.

ingest_external_links_for_dashboards.title: Ingest External Links For Dashboards
ingest_external_links_for_dashboards.description: Ingest a URL to link out to from dashboards.

ingest_external_links_for_charts.title: Ingest External Links For Charts
ingest_external_links_for_charts.description: Ingest a URL to link out to from charts.

extract_project_hierarchy.title: Extract Project Hierarchy
extract_project_hierarchy.description: Whether to extract entire project hierarchy for nested projects.

extract_lineage_from_unsupported_custom_.title: Extract Lineage From Unsupported Custom Sql Queries
extract_lineage_from_unsupported_custom_.description: [Experimental] Whether to extract lineage from unsupported custom sql queries using SQL parsing

force_extraction_of_lineage_from_custom_.title: Force Extraction Of Lineage From Custom Sql Queries
force_extraction_of_lineage_from_custom_.description: [Experimental] Force extraction of lineage from custom sql queries using SQL parsing, ignoring Tableau metadata

sql_parsing_disable_schema_awareness.title: Sql Parsing Disable Schema Awareness
sql_parsing_disable_schema_awareness.description: [Experimental] Ignore pre ingested tables schemas during parsing of SQL queries (allows to workaround ingestion errors when pre ingested schema and queries are out of sync)

ingest_multiple_sites.title: Ingest Multiple Sites
ingest_multiple_sites.description: When enabled, ingests multiple sites the user has access to. If the user doesn't have access to the default site, specify an initial site to query in the site property. By default all sites the user has access to will be ingested. You can filter sites with the site_name_pattern property. This flag is currently only supported for Tableau Server. Tableau Cloud is not supported.

site_name_pattern.title: Site Name Pattern
site_name_pattern.description: Filter for specific Tableau sites. By default, all sites will be included in the ingestion. You can both allow and deny sites based on their name using their name, or a Regex pattern. Deny patterns always take precedence over allow patterns. This property is currently only supported for Tableau Server. Tableau Cloud is not supported.

add_site_container.title: Add Site Container
add_site_container.description: When enabled, sites are added as containers and therefore visible in the folder structure within Datahub.

gcs_config.title: GCSSourceConfig
gcs_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

path_specs.title: Path Specs
path_specs.description: List of PathSpec. See [below](#path-spec) the details about PathSpec

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

max_rows.title: Max Rows
max_rows.description: Maximum number of rows to use when inferring schemas for TSV and CSV files.

number_of_files_to_sample.title: Number Of Files To Sample
number_of_files_to_sample.description: Number of files to list to sample for schema inference. This will be ignored if sample_files is set to False in the pathspec.

grafana_config.title: GrafanaSourceConfig
grafana_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

url.title: Url
url.description: Grafana URL in the format http://your-grafana-instance with no trailing slash

fs_yaml_file.title: Fs Yaml File
fs_yaml_file.description: Path to the `feature_store.yaml` file used to configure the feature store

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: Environment to use when constructing URNs

dbt-cloud_config.title: DBTCloudConfig
dbt-cloud_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits incremental/patch lineage for non-dbt entities. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

env.title: Env
env.description: Environment to use in namespace when constructing URNs.

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

target_platform.title: Target Platform
target_platform.description: The platform that dbt is loading onto. (e.g. bigquery / redshift / postgres etc.)

target_platform_instance.title: Target Platform Instance
target_platform_instance.description: The platform instance for the platform that dbt is operating on. Use this if you have multiple instances of the same platform (e.g. redshift) and need to distinguish between them.

use_identifiers.title: Use Identifiers
use_identifiers.description: Use model identifier instead of model name if defined (if not, default to model name).

entities_enabled.title: Entities Enabled
entities_enabled.description: Controls for enabling / disabling metadata emission for different dbt entities (models, test definitions, test results, etc.)

prefer_sql_parser_lineage.title: Prefer Sql Parser Lineage
prefer_sql_parser_lineage.description: Normally we use dbt's metadata to generate table lineage. When enabled, we prefer results from the SQL parser when generating lineage instead. This can be useful when dbt models reference tables directly, instead of using the ref() macro. This requires that `skip_sources_in_lineage` is enabled.

skip_sources_in_lineage.title: Skip Sources In Lineage
skip_sources_in_lineage.description: [Experimental] When enabled, dbt sources will not be included in the lineage graph. Requires that `entities_enabled.sources` is set to `NO`. This is mainly useful when you have multiple, interdependent dbt projects.

tag_prefix.title: Tag Prefix
tag_prefix.description: Prefix added to tags during ingestion.

node_name_pattern.title: Node Name Pattern
node_name_pattern.description: regex patterns for dbt model names to filter in ingestion.

meta_mapping.title: Meta Mapping
meta_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against dbt meta properties. Refer to the section below on dbt meta automated mappings.

column_meta_mapping.title: Column Meta Mapping
column_meta_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against dbt column meta properties. Refer to the section below on dbt meta automated mappings.

enable_meta_mapping.title: Enable Meta Mapping
enable_meta_mapping.description: When enabled, applies the mappings that are defined through the meta_mapping directives.

query_tag_mapping.title: Query Tag Mapping
query_tag_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against dbt query_tag meta properties. Refer to the section below on dbt meta automated mappings.

enable_query_tag_mapping.title: Enable Query Tag Mapping
enable_query_tag_mapping.description: When enabled, applies the mappings that are defined through the `query_tag_mapping` directives.

write_semantics.title: Write Semantics
write_semantics.description: Whether the new tags, terms and owners to be added will override the existing ones added only by this source or not. Value for this config can be "PATCH" or "OVERRIDE"

strip_user_ids_from_email.title: Strip User Ids From Email
strip_user_ids_from_email.description: Whether or not to strip email id while adding owners using dbt meta actions.

enable_owner_extraction.title: Enable Owner Extraction
enable_owner_extraction.description: When enabled, ownership info will be extracted from the dbt meta

owner_extraction_pattern.title: Owner Extraction Pattern
owner_extraction_pattern.description: Regex string to extract owner from the dbt node using the `(?P<name>...) syntax` of the [match object](https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#match-objects), where the group name must be `owner`. Examples: (1)`r"(?P<owner>(.*)): (\w+) (\w+)"` will extract `jdoe` as the owner from `"jdoe: John Doe"` (2) `r"@(?P<owner>(.*))"` will extract `alice` as the owner from `"@alice"`.

include_env_in_assertion_guid.title: Include Env In Assertion Guid
include_env_in_assertion_guid.description: Prior to version 0.9.4.2, the assertion GUIDs did not include the environment. If you're using multiple dbt ingestion that are only distinguished by env, then you should set this flag to True.

convert_column_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Column Urns To Lowercase
convert_column_urns_to_lowercase.description: When enabled, converts column URNs to lowercase to ensure cross-platform compatibility. If `target_platform` is Snowflake, the default is True.

test_warnings_are_errors.title: Test Warnings Are Errors
test_warnings_are_errors.description: When enabled, dbt test warnings will be treated as failures.

infer_dbt_schemas.title: Infer Dbt Schemas
infer_dbt_schemas.description: When enabled, schemas will be inferred from the dbt node definition.

include_column_lineage.title: Include Column Lineage
include_column_lineage.description: When enabled, column-level lineage will be extracted from the dbt node definition. Requires `infer_dbt_schemas` to be enabled. If you run into issues where the column name casing does not match up with properly, providing a datahub_api or using the rest sink will improve accuracy.

include_compiled_code.title: Include Compiled Code
include_compiled_code.description: When enabled, includes the compiled code in the emitted metadata.

access_url.title: Access Url
access_url.description: The base URL of the dbt Cloud instance to use. This should be the URL you use to access the dbt Cloud UI. It should include the scheme (http/https) and not include a trailing slash. See the access url for your dbt Cloud region here: https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/cloud/about-cloud/regions-ip-addresses

metadata_endpoint.title: Metadata Endpoint
metadata_endpoint.description: The dbt Cloud metadata API endpoint. If not provided, we will try to infer it from the access_url.

token.title: Token
token.description: The API token to use to authenticate with DBT Cloud.

account_id.title: Account Id
account_id.description: The DBT Cloud account ID to use.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: The dbt Cloud project ID to use.

job_id.title: Job Id
job_id.description: The ID of the job to ingest metadata from.

run_id.title: Run Id
run_id.description: The ID of the run to ingest metadata from. If not specified, we'll default to the latest run.

file.title: File
file.description: File path or URL to lineage file to ingest.

preserve_upstream.title: Preserve Upstream
preserve_upstream.description: Whether we want to query datahub-gms for upstream data. False means it will hard replace upstream data for a given entity. True means it will query the backend for existing upstreams and include it in the ingestion run

dbt_config.title: DBTCoreConfig
dbt_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

manifest_path.title: Manifest Path
manifest_path.description: Path to dbt manifest JSON. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/manifest-json Note this can be a local file or a URI.

catalog_path.title: Catalog Path
catalog_path.description: Path to dbt catalog JSON. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/catalog-json Note this can be a local file or a URI.

sources_path.title: Sources Path
sources_path.description: Path to dbt sources JSON. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/sources-json. If not specified, last-modified fields will not be populated. Note this can be a local file or a URI.

run_results_paths.title: Run Results Paths
run_results_paths.description: Path to output of dbt test run as run_results files in JSON format. If not specified, test execution results and model performance metadata will not be populated in DataHub.If invoking dbt multiple times, you can provide paths to multiple run result files. See https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/run-results-json.

only_include_if_in_catalog.title: Only Include If In Catalog
only_include_if_in_catalog.description: [experimental] If true, only include nodes that are also present in the catalog file. This is useful if you only want to include models that have been built by the associated run.

aws_connection.title: Aws Connection
aws_connection.description: When fetching manifest files from s3, configuration for aws connection details

git_info.title: Git Info
git_info.description: Reference to your git location to enable easy navigation from DataHub to your dbt files.

athena_config.title: AthenaConfig
athena_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: Populates view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

username.title: Username
username.description: Username credential. If not specified, detected with boto3 rules. See https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html

database.title: Database
database.description: The athena database to ingest from. If not set it will be autodetected

aws_region.title: Aws Region
aws_region.description: Aws region where your Athena database is located

aws_role_arn.title: Aws Role Arn
aws_role_arn.description: AWS Role arn for Pyathena to assume in its connection

aws_role_assumption_duration.title: Aws Role Assumption Duration
aws_role_assumption_duration.description: Duration to assume the AWS Role for. Maximum of 43200 (12 hours)

s3_staging_dir.title: S3 Staging Dir

work_group.title: Work Group

query_result_location.title: Query Result Location
query_result_location.description: S3 path to the [query result bucket](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/athena/latest/ug/querying.html#query-results-specify-location) which should be used by AWS Athena to store results of thequeries executed by DataHub.

extract_partitions.title: Extract Partitions
extract_partitions.description: Extract partitions for tables. Partition extraction needs to run a query (`select * from table$partitions`) on the table. Disable this if you don't want to grant select permission.

sqlalchemy_config.title: SQLAlchemyGenericConfig
sqlalchemy_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

destination_to_platform_instance.description: A mapping of destination dataset to platform instance. Use destination id as key.

history_sync_lookback_period.description: The number of days to look back when extracting connectors' sync history.

metabase_config.description:

e.g. Orchestrators, Pipelines, BI Tools etc.

platform_instance_map.description: A holder for platform -> platform_instance mappings to generate correct dataset urns

display_uri.title: Display Uri
display_uri.description: optional URL to use in links (if `connect_uri` is only for ingestion)

database_alias_map.title: Database Alias Map
database_alias_map.description: Database name map to use when constructing dataset URN.

engine_platform_map.title: Engine Platform Map
engine_platform_map.description: Custom mappings between metabase database engines and DataHub platforms

database_id_to_instance_map.title: Database Id To Instance Map
database_id_to_instance_map.description: Custom mappings between metabase database id and DataHub platform instance

default_schema.title: Default Schema
default_schema.description: Default schema name to use when schema is not provided in an SQL query

exclude_other_user_collections.title: Exclude Other User Collections
exclude_other_user_collections.description: Flag that if true, exclude other user collections

mlflow_config.title: MLflowConfig
mlflow_config.description: Any source that produces dataset urns in a single environment should inherit this class

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

tracking_uri.title: Tracking Uri
tracking_uri.description: Tracking server URI. If not set, an MLflow default tracking_uri is used (local `mlruns/` directory or `MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI` environment variable)

registry_uri.title: Registry Uri
registry_uri.description: Registry server URI. If not set, an MLflow default registry_uri is used (value of tracking_uri or `MLFLOW_REGISTRY_URI` environment variable)

model_name_separator.title: Model Name Separator
model_name_separator.description: A string which separates model name from its version (e.g. model_1 or model-1)

path.title: Path
path.description: File path to folder or file to ingest, or URL to a remote file. If pointed to a folder, all files with extension {file_extension} (default json) within that folder will be processed.

file_extension.title: File Extension
file_extension.description: When providing a folder to use to read files, set this field to control file extensions that you want the source to process. * is a special value that means process every file regardless of extension

aspect.title: Aspect
aspect.description: Set to an aspect to only read this aspect for ingestion.

count_all_before_starting.title: Count All Before Starting
count_all_before_starting.description: When enabled, counts total number of records in the file before starting. Used for accurate estimation of completion time. Turn it off if startup time is too high.

snowflake_config.title: SnowflakeV2Config
snowflake_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

enable_stateful_profiling.title: Enable Stateful Profiling
enable_stateful_profiling.description: Enable stateful profiling. This will store profiling timestamps per dataset after successful profiling. and will not run profiling again in subsequent run if table has not been updated.

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`). You can also specify relative time with respect to end_time such as '-7 days' Or '-7d'.

enable_stateful_usage_ingestion.title: Enable Stateful Usage Ingestion
enable_stateful_usage_ingestion.description: Enable stateful lineage ingestion. This will store usage window timestamps after successful usage ingestion. and will not run usage ingestion for same timestamps in subsequent run.

enable_stateful_lineage_ingestion.title: Enable Stateful Lineage Ingestion
enable_stateful_lineage_ingestion.description: Enable stateful lineage ingestion. This will store lineage window timestamps after successful lineage ingestion. and will not run lineage ingestion for same timestamps in subsequent run.

top_n_queries.title: Top N Queries
top_n_queries.description: Number of top queries to save to each table.

user_email_pattern.title: User Email Pattern
user_email_pattern.description: regex patterns for user emails to filter in usage.

include_read_operational_stats.title: Include Read Operational Stats
include_read_operational_stats.description: Whether to report read operational stats. Experimental.

email_domain.title: Email Domain
email_domain.description: Email domain of your organization so users can be displayed on UI appropriately.

apply_view_usage_to_tables.title: Apply View Usage To Tables
apply_view_usage_to_tables.description: Whether to apply view's usage to its base tables. If set to True, usage is applied to base tables only.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Will match against the full `database.schema` name if `match_fully_qualified_names` is enabled.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake view->table and table->view lineages. Requires appropriate grants given to the role, and include_table_lineage to be True. view->table lineage requires Snowflake Enterprise Edition or above.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates view->view and table->view column lineage using DataHub's sql parser.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

private_key.title: Private Key
private_key.description:
Private key in a form of '-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
private-key
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----
' if using key pair authentication. Encrypted version of private key will be in a form of '-----BEGIN ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----
encrypted-private-key
-----END ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----
' See: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/key-pair-auth.html

private_key_path.title: Private Key Path
private_key_path.description: The path to the private key if using key pair authentication. Ignored if `private_key` is set. See: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/key-pair-auth.html

private_key_password.title: Private Key Password
private_key_password.description: Password for your private key. Required if using key pair authentication with encrypted private key.

authentication_type.title: Authentication Type
authentication_type.description: The type of authenticator to use when connecting to Snowflake. Supports "DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATOR", "OAUTH_AUTHENTICATOR", "EXTERNAL_BROWSER_AUTHENTICATOR" and "KEY_PAIR_AUTHENTICATOR".

account_id.title: Account Id
account_id.description: Snowflake account identifier. e.g. xy12345,  xy12345.us-east-2.aws, xy12345.us-central1.gcp, xy12345.central-us.azure, xy12345.us-west-2.privatelink. Refer [Account Identifiers](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/admin-account-identifier.html#format-2-legacy-account-locator-in-a-region) for more details.

connect_args.title: Connect Args
connect_args.description: Connect args to pass to Snowflake SqlAlchemy driver

database_pattern.title: Database Pattern
database_pattern.description: Regex patterns for databases to filter in ingestion.

match_fully_qualified_names.title: Match Fully Qualified Names
match_fully_qualified_names.description: Whether `schema_pattern` is matched against fully qualified schema name `<catalog>.<schema>`.

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake table-to-table and s3-to-snowflake table lineage. Requires appropriate grants given to the role and Snowflake Enterprise Edition or above.

include_usage_stats.title: Include Usage Stats
include_usage_stats.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake usage statistics. Requires appropriate grants given to the role.

include_view_definitions.title: Include View Definitions
include_view_definitions.description: If enabled, populates the ingested views' definitions.

include_technical_schema.title: Include Technical Schema
include_technical_schema.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake technical schema and descriptions.

include_primary_keys.title: Include Primary Keys
include_primary_keys.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake primary keys.

include_foreign_keys.title: Include Foreign Keys
include_foreign_keys.description: If enabled, populates the snowflake foreign keys.

include_column_lineage.title: Include Column Lineage
include_column_lineage.description: Populates table->table and view->table column lineage. Requires appropriate grants given to the role and the Snowflake Enterprise Edition or above.

use_queries_v2.title: Use Queries V2
use_queries_v2.description: If enabled, uses the new queries extractor to extract queries from snowflake.

lazy_schema_resolver.title: Lazy Schema Resolver
lazy_schema_resolver.description: If enabled, uses lazy schema resolver to resolve schemas for tables and views. This is useful if you have a large number of schemas and want to avoid bulk fetching the schema for each table/view.

extract_tags.description: Optional. Allowed values are `without_lineage`, `with_lineage`, and `skip` (default). `without_lineage` only extracts tags that have been applied directly to the given entity. `with_lineage` extracts both directly applied and propagated tags, but will be significantly slower. See the [Snowflake documentation](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/object-tagging.html#tag-lineage) for information about tag lineage/propagation.

include_external_url.title: Include External Url
include_external_url.description: Whether to populate Snowsight url for Snowflake Objects

validate_upstreams_against_patterns.title: Validate Upstreams Against Patterns
validate_upstreams_against_patterns.description: Whether to validate upstream snowflake tables against allow-deny patterns

tag_pattern.title: Tag Pattern
tag_pattern.description: List of regex patterns for tags to include in ingestion. Only used if `extract_tags` is enabled.

temporary_tables_pattern.title: Temporary Tables Pattern
temporary_tables_pattern.description: [Advanced] Regex patterns for temporary tables to filter in lineage ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. Defaults are to set in such a way to ignore the temporary staging tables created by known ETL tools.

shares.title: Shares
shares.description: Required if current account owns or consumes snowflake share.If specified, connector creates lineage and siblings relationship between current account's database tables and consumer/producer account's database tables. Map of share name -> details of share.

email_as_user_identifier.title: Email As User Identifier
email_as_user_identifier.description: Format user urns as an email, if the snowflake user's email is set. If `email_domain` is provided, generates email addresses for snowflake users with unset emails, based on their username.

include_assertion_results.title: Include Assertion Results
include_assertion_results.description: Whether to ingest assertion run results for assertions created using Datahub assertions CLI in snowflake
