start_time.description: Earliest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`). You can also specify relative time with respect to end_time such as '-7 days' Or '-7d'.

enable_stateful_usage_ingestion.title: Enable Stateful Usage Ingestion
enable_stateful_usage_ingestion.description: Enable stateful lineage ingestion. This will store usage window timestamps after successful usage ingestion. and will not run usage ingestion for same timestamps in subsequent run.

top_n_queries.title: Top N Queries
top_n_queries.description: Number of top queries to save to each table.

user_email_pattern.title: User Email Pattern
user_email_pattern.description: regex patterns for user emails to filter in usage.

include_read_operational_stats.title: Include Read Operational Stats
include_read_operational_stats.description: Whether to report read operational stats. Experimental.

email_domain.title: Email Domain
email_domain.description: Email domain of your organisation so users can be displayed on UI appropriately.

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

s3_lineage_config.title: S3 Lineage Config
s3_lineage_config.description: Common config for S3 lineage generation

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance_map.title: Platform Instance Map
platform_instance_map.description: A holder for platform -> platform_instance mappings to generate correct dataset urns

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs. To set connection arguments in the URL, specify them under `connect_args`.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: Populates view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

default_schema.title: Default Schema
default_schema.description: The default schema to use if the sql parser fails to parse the schema with `sql_based` lineage collector

is_serverless.title: Is Serverless
is_serverless.description: Whether target Redshift instance is serverless (alternative is provisioned cluster)

use_lineage_v2.title: Use Lineage V2
use_lineage_v2.description: Whether to use the new SQL-based lineage collector.

lineage_v2_generate_queries.title: Lineage V2 Generate Queries
lineage_v2_generate_queries.description: Whether to generate queries entities for the new SQL-based lineage collector.

include_table_lineage.title: Include Table Lineage
include_table_lineage.description: Whether table lineage should be ingested.

include_copy_lineage.title: Include Copy Lineage
include_copy_lineage.description: Whether lineage should be collected from copy commands

include_usage_statistics.title: Include Usage Statistics
include_usage_statistics.description: Generate usage statistic. email_domain config parameter needs to be set if enabled

include_unload_lineage.title: Include Unload Lineage
include_unload_lineage.description: Whether lineage should be collected from unload commands

include_table_rename_lineage.title: Include Table Rename Lineage
include_table_rename_lineage.description: Whether we should follow `alter table ... rename to` statements when computing lineage.

table_lineage_mode.description: Which table lineage collector mode to use. Available modes are: [stl_scan_based, sql_based, mixed]

match_fully_qualified_names.title: Match Fully Qualified Names
match_fully_qualified_names.description: Whether `schema_pattern` is matched against fully qualified schema name `<database>.<schema>`.

extract_column_level_lineage.title: Extract Column Level Lineage
extract_column_level_lineage.description: Whether to extract column level lineage. This config works with rest-sink only.

patch_custom_properties.title: Patch Custom Properties
patch_custom_properties.description: Whether to patch custom properties on existing datasets rather than replace.

resolve_temp_table_in_lineage.title: Resolve Temp Table In Lineage
resolve_temp_table_in_lineage.description: Whether to resolve temp table appear in lineage to upstream permanent tables.

looker_config.title: LookerDashboardSourceConfig
looker_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

explore_naming_pattern.title: Explore Naming Pattern
explore_naming_pattern.description: Pattern for providing dataset names to explores. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name']

explore_browse_pattern.title: Explore Browse Pattern
explore_browse_pattern.description: Pattern for providing browse paths to explores. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name']

view_naming_pattern.title: View Naming Pattern
view_naming_pattern.description: Pattern for providing dataset names to views. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name', 'file_path', 'folder_path']

view_browse_pattern.title: View Browse Pattern
view_browse_pattern.description: Pattern for providing browse paths to views. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name', 'file_path', 'folder_path']

tag_measures_and_dimensions.title: Tag Measures And Dimensions
tag_measures_and_dimensions.description: When enabled, attaches tags to measures, dimensions and dimension groups to make them more discoverable. When disabled, adds this information to the description of the column.

extract_column_level_lineage.title: Extract Column Level Lineage
extract_column_level_lineage.description: When enabled, extracts column-level lineage from Views and Explores

base_url.title: Base Url
base_url.description: Url to your Looker instance: `https://company.looker.com:19999` or `https://looker.company.com`, or similar. Used for making API calls to Looker and constructing clickable dashboard and chart urls.

transport_options.title: Transport Options
transport_options.description: Populates the [TransportOptions](https://github.com/looker-open-source/sdk-codegen/blob/94d6047a0d52912ac082eb91616c1e7c379ab262/python/looker_sdk/rtl/transport.py#L70) struct for looker client

max_retries.title: Max Retries
max_retries.description: Number of retries for Looker API calls

dashboard_pattern.title: Dashboard Pattern
dashboard_pattern.description: Patterns for selecting dashboard ids that are to be included

chart_pattern.title: Chart Pattern
chart_pattern.description: Patterns for selecting chart ids that are to be included

include_deleted.title: Include Deleted
include_deleted.description: Whether to include deleted dashboards and looks.

extract_owners.title: Extract Owners
extract_owners.description: When enabled, extracts ownership from Looker directly. When disabled, ownership is left empty for dashboards and charts.

strip_user_ids_from_email.title: Strip User Ids From Email
strip_user_ids_from_email.description: When enabled, converts Looker user emails of the form name@domain.com to urn:li:corpuser:name when assigning ownership

skip_personal_folders.title: Skip Personal Folders
skip_personal_folders.description: Whether to skip ingestion of dashboards in personal folders. Setting this to True will only ingest dashboards in the Shared folder space.

max_threads.title: Max Threads
max_threads.description: Max parallelism for Looker API calls. Defaults to cpuCount or 40

external_base_url.title: External Base Url
external_base_url.description: Optional URL to use when constructing external URLs to Looker if the `base_url` is not the correct one to use. For example, `https://looker-public.company.com`. If not provided, the external base URL will default to `base_url`.

extract_usage_history.title: Extract Usage History
extract_usage_history.description: Whether to ingest usage statistics for dashboards. Setting this to True will query looker system activity explores to fetch historical dashboard usage.

extract_usage_history_for_interval.title: Extract Usage History For Interval
extract_usage_history_for_interval.description: Used only if extract_usage_history is set to True. Interval to extract looker dashboard usage history for. See https://docs.looker.com/reference/filter-expressions#date_and_time.

extract_embed_urls.title: Extract Embed Urls
extract_embed_urls.description: Produce URLs used to render Looker Explores as Previews inside of DataHub UI. Embeds must be enabled inside of Looker to use this feature.

extract_independent_looks.title: Extract Independent Looks
extract_independent_looks.description: Extract looks which are not part of any Dashboard. To enable this flag the stateful_ingestion should also be enabled.

emit_used_explores_only.title: Emit Used Explores Only
emit_used_explores_only.description: When enabled, only explores that are used by a Dashboard/Look will be ingested.

include_platform_instance_in_urns.title: Include Platform Instance In Urns
include_platform_instance_in_urns.description: When enabled, platform instance will be added in dashboard and chart urn.

folder_path_pattern.title: Folder Path Pattern
folder_path_pattern.description:
Allow or deny dashboards from specific folders. For example: 
deny: 
 - sales/deprecated 
This pattern will deny the ingestion of all dashboards and looks within the sales/deprecated folder. 
Dashboards will only be ingested if they're allowed by both this config and dashboard_pattern.

dynamodb_config.title: DynamoDBConfig
dynamodb_config.description: Any source that is a primary producer of Dataset metadata should inherit this class

aws_access_key_id.title: Aws Access Key Id
aws_access_key_id.description: AWS access key ID. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_secret_access_key.title: Aws Secret Access Key
aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_session_token.title: Aws Session Token
aws_session_token.description: AWS session token. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_role.title: Aws Role
aws_role.description: AWS roles to assume. If using the string format, the role ARN can be specified directly. If using the object format, the role can be specified in the RoleArn field and additional available arguments are the same as [boto3's STS.Client.assume_role](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/sts.html?highlight=assume_role#STS.Client.assume_role).

aws_profile.title: Aws Profile
aws_profile.description: Named AWS profile to use. Only used if access key / secret are unset. If not set the default will be used

aws_endpoint_url.title: Aws Endpoint Url
aws_endpoint_url.description: The AWS service endpoint. This is normally [constructed automatically](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/core/session.html), but can be overridden here.

aws_proxy.title: Aws Proxy
aws_proxy.description: A set of proxy configs to use with AWS. See the [botocore.config](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html) docs for details.

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout for reading from the connection (in seconds).

aws_advanced_config.title: Aws Advanced Config
aws_advanced_config.description: Advanced AWS configuration options. These are passed directly to [botocore.config.Config](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html).

env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

database_pattern.description: regex patterns for databases to filter in ingestion.

table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. The table name format is 'region.table'

platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

include_table_item.description: [Advanced] The primary keys of items of a table in dynamodb format the user would like to include in schema. Refer "Advanced Configurations" section for more details

kafka-connect_config.description: Any source that connects to a platform should inherit this class

url_prefix.title: Url Prefix
url_prefix.description: There are cases where an enterprise would have multiple elastic search clusters. One way for them to manage is to have a single endpoint for all the elastic search clusters and use url_prefix for routing requests to different clusters.

collapse_urns.title: Collapse Urns
collapse_urns.description:
List of regex patterns to remove from the name of the URN. All of the indices before removal of URNs are considered as the same dataset. These are applied in order for each URN.
        The main case where you would want to have multiple of these if the name where you are trying to remove suffix from have different formats.
        e.g. ending with -YYYY-MM-DD as well as ending -epochtime would require you to have 2 regex patterns to remove the suffixes across all URNs.

sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

views_where_clause_suffix.description: Where clause to specify what Presto views should be ingested.

tables_where_clause_suffix.title: Tables Where Clause Suffix

schemas_where_clause_suffix.title: Schemas Where Clause Suffix
schemas_where_clause_suffix.description: Where clause to specify what Hive schemas should be ingested.

database_pattern.description: Regex patterns for hive/presto database to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the database name. e.g. to match all tables in database analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

metastore_db_name.title: Metastore Db Name
metastore_db_name.description: Name of the Hive metastore's database (usually: metastore). For backward compatibility, if this field is not provided, the database field will be used. If both the 'database' and 'metastore_db_name' fields are set then the 'database' field will be used to filter the hive/presto/trino database

mode.description: The ingested data will be stored under this platform. Valid options: ['hive', 'presto', 'presto-on-hive', 'trino']

use_catalog_subtype.title: Use Catalog Subtype
use_catalog_subtype.description: Container Subtype name to be 'Database' or 'Catalog' Valid options: ['True', 'False']

use_dataset_pascalcase_subtype.title: Use Dataset Pascalcase Subtype
use_dataset_pascalcase_subtype.description: Dataset Subtype name to be 'Table' or 'View' Valid options: ['True', 'False']

include_catalog_name_in_ids.description: Add the Presto catalog name (e.g. hive) to the generated dataset urns. `urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:hive,hive.user.logging_events,PROD)` versus `urn:li:dataset:(urn:li:dataPlatform:hive,user.logging_events,PROD)`

enable_properties_merge.title: Enable Properties Merge
enable_properties_merge.description: By default, the connector enables merging of properties with what exists on the server. Set this to False to enable the default connector behavior of overwriting properties on each ingestion.

simplify_nested_field_paths.title: Simplify Nested Field Paths
simplify_nested_field_paths.description: Simplify v2 field paths to v1 by default. If the schema has Union or Array types, still falls back to v2

bot_token.title: Bot Token
bot_token.description: Bot token for the Slack workspace. Needs `users:read`, `users:read.email` and `users.profile:read` scopes.

api_requests_per_min.title: Api Requests Per Min
api_requests_per_min.description: Number of API requests per minute. Low-level config. Do not tweak unless you are facing any issues.

ingest_public_channels.title: Ingest Public Channels
ingest_public_channels.description: Whether to ingest public channels. If set to true needs `channels:read` scope.

channels_iteration_limit.title: Channels Iteration Limit
channels_iteration_limit.description: Limit the number of channels to be ingested in a iteration. Low-level config. Do not tweak unless you are facing any issues.

channel_min_members.title: Channel Min Members
channel_min_members.description: Ingest channels with at least this many members.

file.title: File
file.description: File path or URL to business glossary file to ingest.

enable_auto_id.title: Enable Auto Id
enable_auto_id.description: Generate guid urns instead of a plaintext path urn with the node/term's hierarchy.

iceberg_config.title: IcebergSourceConfig
iceberg_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

catalog.title: Catalog
catalog.description: Catalog configuration where to find Iceberg tables.  Only one catalog specification is supported.  The format is the same as [pyiceberg's catalog configuration](https://py.iceberg.apache.org/configuration/), where the catalog name is specified as the object name and attributes are set as key-value pairs.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion.

user_ownership_property.title: User Ownership Property
user_ownership_property.description: Iceberg table property to look for a `CorpUser` owner.  Can only hold a single user value.  If property has no value, no owner information will be emitted.

group_ownership_property.title: Group Ownership Property
group_ownership_property.description: Iceberg table property to look for a `CorpGroup` owner.  Can only hold a single group value.  If property has no value, no owner information will be emitted.

mongodb_config.title: MongoDBConfig
mongodb_config.description: Any source that connects to a platform should inherit this class

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Additional options to pass to `pymongo.MongoClient()`.

schemaSamplingSize.title: Schemasamplingsize
schemaSamplingSize.description: Number of documents to use when inferring schema size. If set to `null`, all documents will be scanned.

useRandomSampling.title: Userandomsampling
useRandomSampling.description: If documents for schema inference should be randomly selected. If `False`, documents will be selected from start.

maxSchemaSize.title: Maxschemasize
maxSchemaSize.description: Maximum number of fields to include in the schema.

hostingEnvironment.description: Hosting environment of MongoDB, default is SELF_HOSTED, currently support `SELF_HOSTED`, `ATLAS`, `AWS_DOCUMENTDB`

database_pattern.title: Database Pattern
database_pattern.description: regex patterns for databases to filter in ingestion.

collection_pattern.title: Collection Pattern
collection_pattern.description: regex patterns for collections to filter in ingestion.

sigma_config.title: SigmaSourceConfig
sigma_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

workspace_pattern.title: Workspace Pattern
workspace_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter Sigma workspaces in ingestion.Mention 'My documents' if personal entities also need to ingest.

ingest_owner.title: Ingest Owner
ingest_owner.description: Ingest Owner from source. This will override Owner info entered from UI.

ingest_shared_entities.title: Ingest Shared Entities
ingest_shared_entities.description: Whether to ingest the shared entities or not.

extract_lineage.title: Extract Lineage
extract_lineage.description: Whether to extract lineage of workbook's elements and datasets or not.

workbook_lineage_pattern.title: Workbook Lineage Pattern
workbook_lineage_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter workbook's elements and datasets lineage in ingestion.Requires extract_lineage to be enabled.

chart_sources_platform_mapping.title: Chart Sources Platform Mapping
chart_sources_platform_mapping.description: A mapping of the sigma workspace/workbook/chart folder path to all chart's data sources platform details present inside that folder path.

unity-catalog_config.title: UnityCatalogSourceConfig
unity-catalog_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

enable_stateful_profiling.title: Enable Stateful Profiling
enable_stateful_profiling.description: Enable stateful profiling. This will store profiling timestamps per dataset after successful profiling. and will not run profiling again in subsequent run if table has not been updated.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`). You can also specify relative time with respect to end_time such as '-7 days' Or '-7d'.

top_n_queries.title: Top N Queries
top_n_queries.description: Number of top queries to save to each table.

user_email_pattern.title: User Email Pattern
user_email_pattern.description: regex patterns for user emails to filter in usage.

include_read_operational_stats.title: Include Read Operational Stats
include_read_operational_stats.description: Whether to report read operational stats. Experimental.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to the full `metastore.catalog.schema` name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex `^mymetastore\.mycatalog\.analytics$`.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in `catalog.schema.table` format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer catalog and public schema, use the regex `Customer\.public\.customer.*`.

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to catalogs, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: Populates view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

warehouse_id.title: Warehouse Id
warehouse_id.description: SQL Warehouse id, for running queries. If not set, will use the default warehouse.

include_hive_metastore.title: Include Hive Metastore
include_hive_metastore.description: Whether to ingest legacy `hive_metastore` catalog. This requires executing queries on SQL warehouse.

workspace_name.title: Workspace Name
workspace_name.description: Name of the workspace. Default to deployment name present in workspace_url

include_metastore.title: Include Metastore
include_metastore.description: Whether to ingest the workspace's metastore as a container and include it in all urns. Changing this will affect the urns of all entities in the workspace. This config is deprecated and will be removed in the future, so it is recommended to not set this to `True` for new ingestions. If you have an existing unity catalog ingestion, you'll want to avoid duplicates by soft deleting existing data. If stateful ingestion is enabled, running with `include_metastore: false` should be sufficient. Otherwise, we recommend deleting via the cli: `datahub delete --platform databricks` and re-ingesting with `include_metastore: false`.

ingest_data_platform_instance_aspect.title: Ingest Data Platform Instance Aspect
ingest_data_platform_instance_aspect.description: Option to enable/disable ingestion of the data platform instance aspect. The default data platform instance id for a dataset is workspace_name

catalogs.title: Catalogs
catalogs.description: Fixed list of catalogs to ingest. If not specified, catalogs will be ingested based on `catalog_pattern`.

catalog_pattern.title: Catalog Pattern
catalog_pattern.description: Regex patterns for catalogs to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the full `metastore.catalog` name.

notebook_pattern.title: Notebook Pattern
notebook_pattern.description: Regex patterns for notebooks to filter in ingestion, based on notebook *path*. Specify regex to match the entire notebook path in `/<dir>/.../<name>` format. e.g. to match all notebooks in the root Shared directory, use the regex `/Shared/.*`.

include_external_lineage.title: Include External Lineage
include_external_lineage.description: Option to enable/disable lineage generation for external tables. Only external S3 tables are supported at the moment.

include_notebooks.title: Include Notebooks
include_notebooks.description: Ingest notebooks, represented as DataHub datasets.

include_ownership.title: Include Ownership
include_ownership.description: Option to enable/disable ownership generation for metastores, catalogs, schemas, and tables.

include_column_lineage.title: Include Column Lineage
include_column_lineage.description: Option to enable/disable lineage generation. Currently we have to call a rest call per column to get column level lineage due to the Databrick api which can slow down ingestion.

column_lineage_column_limit.title: Column Lineage Column Limit
column_lineage_column_limit.description: Limit the number of columns to get column level lineage.

emit_siblings.title: Emit Siblings
emit_siblings.description: Whether to emit siblings relation with corresponding delta-lake platform's table. If enabled, this will also ingest the corresponding delta-lake table.

delta_lake_options.title: Delta Lake Options
delta_lake_options.description: Details about the delta lake, incase to emit siblings

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: File path or URL of CSV file to ingest.

write_semantics.title: Write Semantics
write_semantics.description: Whether the new tags, terms and owners to be added will override the existing ones added only by this source or not. Value for this config can be "PATCH" or "OVERRIDE"

delimiter.title: Delimiter
delimiter.description: Delimiter to use when parsing CSV

array_delimiter.title: Array Delimiter
array_delimiter.description: Delimiter to use when parsing array fields (tags, terms and owners)

token_url.description: The token URL that acquires a token from Azure AD for authorizing requests.  This source will only work with v1.0 endpoint.

azure_ad_response_to_username_attr.description: Which Azure AD User Response attribute to use as input to DataHub username mapping.

azure_ad_response_to_username_regex.title: Azure Ad Response To Username Regex
azure_ad_response_to_username_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub username from the attribute specified in `azure_ad_response_to_username_attr`.

azure_ad_response_to_groupname_attr.title: Azure Ad Response To Groupname Attr
azure_ad_response_to_groupname_attr.description: Which Azure AD Group Response attribute to use as input to DataHub group name mapping.

azure_ad_response_to_groupname_regex.title: Azure Ad Response To Groupname Regex
azure_ad_response_to_groupname_regex.description: A regex used to parse the DataHub group name from the attribute specified in `azure_ad_response_to_groupname_attr`.

ingest_users.title: Ingest Users
ingest_users.description: Whether users should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_groups.title: Ingest Groups
ingest_groups.description: Whether groups should be ingested into DataHub.

ingest_group_membership.title: Ingest Group Membership
ingest_group_membership.description: Whether group membership should be ingested into DataHub. ingest_groups must be True if this is True.

ingest_groups_users.title: Ingest Groups Users
ingest_groups_users.description: This option is useful only when `ingest_users` is set to False and `ingest_group_membership` to True. As effect, only the users which belongs to the selected groups will be ingested.

users_pattern.title: Users Pattern
users_pattern.description: regex patterns for users to filter in ingestion.

groups_pattern.title: Groups Pattern
groups_pattern.description: regex patterns for groups to include in ingestion.

filtered_tracking.title: Filtered Tracking
filtered_tracking.description: If enabled, report will contain names of filtered users and groups.

mask_group_id.title: Mask Group Id
mask_group_id.description: Whether workunit ID's for groups should be masked to avoid leaking sensitive information.

mask_user_id.title: Mask User Id
mask_user_id.description: Whether workunit ID's for users should be masked to avoid leaking sensitive information.

ingest_tags.description: Ingest Tags from source. This will override Tags entered from UI

env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

site_url.description: URL for Nifi, ending with /nifi/. e.g. https://mynifi.domain/nifi/

auth.description: Nifi authentication. must be one of : NO_AUTH, SINGLE_USER, CLIENT_CERT, KERBEROS

provenance_days.title: Provenance Days
provenance_days.description: time window to analyze provenance events for external datasets

process_group_pattern.title: Process Group Pattern
process_group_pattern.description: regex patterns for filtering process groups

site_name.title: Site Name
site_name.description: Site name to identify this site with, useful when using input and output ports receiving remote connections

site_url_to_site_name.title: Site Url To Site Name
site_url_to_site_name.description: Lookup to find site_name for site_url ending with /nifi/, required if using remote process groups in nifi flow

username.title: Username
username.description: Nifi username, must be set for auth = "SINGLE_USER"

password.title: Password
password.description: Nifi password, must be set for auth = "SINGLE_USER"

client_cert_file.title: Client Cert File
client_cert_file.description: Path to PEM file containing the public certificates for the user/client identity, must be set for auth = "CLIENT_CERT"

client_key_file.title: Client Key File
client_key_file.description: Path to PEM file containing the client’s secret key

client_key_password.title: Client Key Password
client_key_password.description: The password to decrypt the client_key_file

ca_file.title: Ca File
ca_file.description: Path to PEM file containing certs for the root CA(s) for the NiFi.Set to False to disable SSL verification.

emit_process_group_as_container.title: Emit Process Group As Container
emit_process_group_as_container.description: Whether to emit Nifi process groups as container entities.

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits incremental/patch lineage for Nifi processors. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

trino_config.title: TrinoConfig
trino_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs. To set connection arguments in the URL, specify them under `connect_args`.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: Populates view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

catalog_to_connector_details.title: Catalog To Connector Details
catalog_to_connector_details.description: A mapping of trino catalog to its connector details like connector database, env and platform instance.This configuration is used to build lineage to the underlying connector. Use catalog name as key.

ingest_lineage_to_connectors.description: Whether lineage of datasets to connectors should be ingested

trino_as_primary.title: Trino As Primary
trino_as_primary.description: Experimental feature. Whether trino dataset should be primary entity of the set of siblings

lookml_config.title: LookMLSourceConfig
lookml_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

explore_naming_pattern.title: Explore Naming Pattern
explore_naming_pattern.description: Pattern for providing dataset names to explores. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name']

explore_browse_pattern.title: Explore Browse Pattern
explore_browse_pattern.description: Pattern for providing browse paths to explores. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name']

view_naming_pattern.title: View Naming Pattern
view_naming_pattern.description: Pattern for providing dataset names to views. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name', 'file_path', 'folder_path']

view_browse_pattern.title: View Browse Pattern
view_browse_pattern.description: Pattern for providing browse paths to views. Allowed variables are ['platform', 'env', 'project', 'model', 'name', 'file_path', 'folder_path']

tag_measures_and_dimensions.title: Tag Measures And Dimensions
tag_measures_and_dimensions.description: When enabled, attaches tags to measures, dimensions and dimension groups to make them more discoverable. When disabled, adds this information to the description of the column.

extract_column_level_lineage.title: Extract Column Level Lineage
extract_column_level_lineage.description: When enabled, extracts column-level lineage from Views and Explores

git_info.title: Git Info
git_info.description: Reference to your git location. If present, supplies handy links to your lookml on the dataset entity page.

base_folder.title: Base Folder
base_folder.description: Required if not providing github configuration and deploy keys. A pointer to a local directory (accessible to the ingestion system) where the root of the LookML repo has been checked out (typically via a git clone). This is typically the root folder where the `*.model.lkml` and `*.view.lkml` files are stored. e.g. If you have checked out your LookML repo under `/Users/jdoe/workspace/my-lookml-repo`, then set `base_folder` to `/Users/jdoe/workspace/my-lookml-repo`.

project_dependencies.title: Project Dependencies
project_dependencies.description: A map of project_name to local directory (accessible to the ingestion system) or Git credentials. Every local_dependencies or private remote_dependency listed in the main project's manifest.lkml file should have a corresponding entry here.If a deploy key is not provided, the ingestion system will use the same deploy key as the main project.

connection_to_platform_map.title: Connection To Platform Map
connection_to_platform_map.description: A mapping of [Looker connection names](https://docs.looker.com/reference/model-params/connection-for-model) to DataHub platform, database, and schema values.

model_pattern.title: Model Pattern
model_pattern.description: List of regex patterns for LookML models to include in the extraction.

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: List of regex patterns for LookML views to include in the extraction.

project_name.title: Project Name
project_name.description: Required if you don't specify the `api` section. The project name within which all the model files live. See (https://docs.looker.com/data-modeling/getting-started/how-project-works) to understand what the Looker project name should be. The simplest way to see your projects is to click on `Develop` followed by `Manage LookML Projects` in the Looker application.

transport_options.title: Transport Options
transport_options.description: Populates the [TransportOptions](https://github.com/looker-open-source/sdk-codegen/blob/94d6047a0d52912ac082eb91616c1e7c379ab262/python/looker_sdk/rtl/transport.py#L70) struct for looker client

max_file_snippet_length.title: Max File Snippet Length
max_file_snippet_length.description: When extracting the view definition from a lookml file, the maximum number of characters to extract.

emit_reachable_views_only.title: Emit Reachable Views Only
emit_reachable_views_only.description: When enabled, only views that are reachable from explores defined in the model files are emitted

populate_sql_logic_for_missing_descripti.title: Populate Sql Logic For Missing Descriptions
populate_sql_logic_for_missing_descripti.description: When enabled, field descriptions will include the sql logic for computed fields if descriptions are missing

process_isolation_for_sql_parsing.title: Process Isolation For Sql Parsing
process_isolation_for_sql_parsing.description: When enabled, sql parsing will be executed in a separate process to prevent memory leaks.

process_refinements.title: Process Refinements
process_refinements.description: When enabled, looker refinement will be processed to adapt an existing view.

liquid_variable.title: Liquid Variable
liquid_variable.description: A dictionary containing Liquid variables and their corresponding values, utilized in SQL-defined derived views. The Liquid template will be resolved in view.derived_table.sql and view.sql_table_name. Defaults to an empty dictionary.

looker_environment.title: Looker Environment
looker_environment.description: A looker prod or dev environment. It helps to evaluate looker if comments i.e. -- if prod --. All if comments are evaluated to true for configured looker_environment value

glue_config.title: GlueSourceConfig
glue_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

aws_access_key_id.title: Aws Access Key Id
aws_access_key_id.description: AWS access key ID. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_secret_access_key.title: Aws Secret Access Key
aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_session_token.title: Aws Session Token
aws_session_token.description: AWS session token. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_role.title: Aws Role
aws_role.description: AWS roles to assume. If using the string format, the role ARN can be specified directly. If using the object format, the role can be specified in the RoleArn field and additional available arguments are the same as [boto3's STS.Client.assume_role](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/sts.html?highlight=assume_role#STS.Client.assume_role).

aws_profile.title: Aws Profile
aws_profile.description: Named AWS profile to use. Only used if access key / secret are unset. If not set the default will be used

aws_endpoint_url.title: Aws Endpoint Url
aws_endpoint_url.description: The AWS service endpoint. This is normally [constructed automatically](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/core/session.html), but can be overridden here.

aws_proxy.title: Aws Proxy
aws_proxy.description: A set of proxy configs to use with AWS. See the [botocore.config](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html) docs for details.

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout for reading from the connection (in seconds).

aws_advanced_config.title: Aws Advanced Config
aws_advanced_config.description: Advanced AWS configuration options. These are passed directly to [botocore.config.Config](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html).

platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

platform.description: The platform to use for the dataset URNs. Must be one of ['glue', 'athena'].

extract_owners.description: When enabled, extracts ownership from Glue table property and overwrites existing owners (DATAOWNER). When disabled, ownership is left empty for datasets. Expects a corpGroup urn, a corpuser urn or only the identifier part for the latter. Not used in the normal course of AWS Glue operations.

extract_transforms.title: Extract Transforms
extract_transforms.description: Whether to extract Glue transform jobs.

ignore_unsupported_connectors.title: Ignore Unsupported Connectors
ignore_unsupported_connectors.description: Whether to ignore unsupported connectors. If disabled, an error will be raised.

glue_s3_lineage_direction.title: Glue S3 Lineage Direction
glue_s3_lineage_direction.description: If `upstream`, S3 is upstream to Glue. If `downstream` S3 is downstream to Glue.

domain.description: regex patterns for tables to filter to assign domain_key.

catalog_id.description: The aws account id where the target glue catalog lives. If None, datahub will ingest glue in aws caller's account.

ignore_resource_links.title: Ignore Resource Links
ignore_resource_links.description: If set to True, ignore database resource links.

use_s3_bucket_tags.description: If an S3 Buckets Tags should be created for the Tables ingested by Glue. Please Note that this will not apply tags to any folders ingested, only the files.

use_s3_object_tags.title: Use S3 Object Tags
use_s3_object_tags.description: If an S3 Objects Tags should be created for the Tables ingested by Glue.

profiling.title: Profiling
profiling.description: Configs to ingest data profiles from glue table

cleanup_expired_tokens.title: Cleanup Expired Tokens
cleanup_expired_tokens.description: Whether to clean up expired tokens or not

truncate_indices.title: Truncate Indices
truncate_indices.description: Whether to truncate elasticsearch indices or not which can be safely truncated

truncate_index_older_than_days.title: Truncate Index Older Than Days
truncate_index_older_than_days.description: Indices older than this number of days will be truncated

truncation_watch_until.title: Truncation Watch Until
truncation_watch_until.description: Wait for truncation of indices until this number of documents are left

vertica_config.title: VerticaConfig
vertica_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

schema_pattern.title: Schema Pattern
schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns for tables to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to match the entire table name in database.schema.table format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

view_pattern.title: View Pattern
view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

incremental_lineage.title: Incremental Lineage
incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs. To set connection arguments in the URL, specify them under `connect_args`.

profile_pattern.title: Profile Pattern
profile_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables (or specific columns) for profiling during ingestion. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include view lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

require_files.description: Whether DeltaTable should track files. Consider setting this to `False` for large delta tables, resulting in significant memory reduction for ingestion process.When set to `False`, number_of_files in delta table can not be reported.

metastore_db_name.description: Name of the Hive metastore's database (usually: metastore). For backward compatibility, if this field is not provided, the database field will be used. mode.description: The ingested data will be stored under this platform. Valid options: ['hive', 'presto', 'presto-on-hive', 'trino']

use_catalog_subtype.title: Use Catalog Subtype

use_dataset_pascalcase_subtype.title: Use Dataset Pascalcase Subtype

enable_properties_merge.title: Enable Properties Merge
enable_properties_merge.description: By default, the connector enables merging of properties with what exists on the server. Set this to False to enable the default connector behavior of overwriting properties on each ingestion.

simplify_nested_field_paths.title: Simplify Nested Field Paths
simplify_nested_field_paths.description: Simplify v2 field paths to v1 by default. If the schema has Union or Array types, still falls back to v2

Common AWS credentials config.

Currently used by:
    - Glue source
    - DynamoDB source
    - SageMaker source

aws_access_key_id.title: Aws Access Key Id
aws_access_key_id.description: AWS access key ID. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_secret_access_key.title: Aws Secret Access Key
aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_session_token.title: Aws Session Token
aws_session_token.description: AWS session token. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_role.title: Aws Role
aws_role.description: AWS roles to assume. If using the string format, the role ARN can be specified directly. If using the object format, the role can be specified in the RoleArn field and additional available arguments are the same as [boto3's STS.Client.assume_role](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/sts.html?highlight=assume_role#STS.Client.assume_role).

aws_profile.title: Aws Profile

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout for reading from the connection (in seconds).

aws_advanced_config.title: Aws Advanced Config
aws_advanced_config.description: Advanced AWS configuration options. These are passed directly to [botocore.config.Config](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html).

schema_pattern.description: Regex patterns for schemas to filter in ingestion. Specify regex to only match the schema name. e.g. to match all tables in schema analytics, use the regex 'analytics'

view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. incremental_lineage.description: When enabled, emits lineage as incremental to existing lineage already in DataHub. When disabled, re-states lineage on each run.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs. To set connection arguments in the URL, specify them under `connect_args`.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: Attach domains to databases, schemas or tables during ingestion using regex patterns. Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_table_location_lineage.title: Include Table Location Lineage
include_table_location_lineage.description: If the source supports it, include table lineage to the underlying storage location.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage
include_view_lineage.description: Populates view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser.

include_view_column_lineage.title: Include View Column Lineage
include_view_column_lineage.description: Populates column-level lineage for  view->view and table->view lineage using DataHub's sql parser. Requires `include_view_lineage` to be enabled.

use_file_backed_cache.title: Use File Backed Cache
use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: Will be set automatically to default value.

sqlalchemy_uri.title: Sqlalchemy Uri
sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

service_name.title: Service Name
service_name.description: Oracle service name. If using, omit `database`.

add_database_name_to_urn.title: Add Database Name To Urn
add_database_name_to_urn.description: Add oracle database name to urn, default urn is schema.table

data_dictionary_mode.title: Data Dictionary Mode
data_dictionary_mode.description: The data dictionary views mode, to extract information about schema objects ('ALL' and 'DBA' views are supported). (https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E11882_01/nav/catalog_views.htm)

mariadb_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

view_pattern.description: Regex patterns for views to filter in ingestion. Note: Defaults to table_pattern if not specified. Specify regex to match the entire view name in database.schema.view format. e.g. to match all views starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

Domain key can be a guid like *urn:li:domain:ec428203-ce86-4db3-985d-5a8ee6df32ba* or a string like "Marketing".) If you provide strings, then datahub will attempt to resolve this name to a guid, and will error out if this fails. There can be multiple domain keys specified.

include_view_lineage.title: Include View Lineage

use_file_backed_cache.description: Whether to use a file backed cache for the view definitions.
