kafka_config.title: KafkaSourceConfig
kafka_config.description: Base configuration class for stateful ingestion for source configs to inherit from.

convert_urns_to_lowercase.title: Convert Urns To Lowercase
convert_urns_to_lowercase.description: Whether to convert dataset urns to lowercase.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: A map of domain names to allow deny patterns. Domains can be urn-based (`urn:li:domain:13ae4d85-d955-49fc-8474-9004c663a810`) or bare (`13ae4d85-d955-49fc-8474-9004c663a810`).

topic_subject_map.title: Topic Subject Map
topic_subject_map.description: Provides the mapping for the `key` and the `value` schemas of a topic to the corresponding schema registry subject name. Each entry of this map has the form `<topic_name>-key`:`<schema_registry_subject_name_for_key_schema>` and `<topic_name>-value`:`<schema_registry_subject_name_for_value_schema>` for the key and the value schemas associated with the topic, respectively. This parameter is mandatory when the [RecordNameStrategy](https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/schema-registry/serdes-develop/index.html#how-the-naming-strategies-work) is used as the subject naming strategy in the kafka schema registry. NOTE: When provided, this overrides the default subject name resolution even when the `TopicNameStrategy` or the `TopicRecordNameStrategy` are used.

schema_registry_class.title: Schema Registry Class
schema_registry_class.description: The fully qualified implementation class(custom) that implements the KafkaSchemaRegistryBase interface.

schema_tags_field.title: Schema Tags Field
schema_tags_field.description: The field name in the schema metadata that contains the tags to be added to the dataset.

enable_meta_mapping.title: Enable Meta Mapping
enable_meta_mapping.description: When enabled, applies the mappings that are defined through the meta_mapping directives.

meta_mapping.title: Meta Mapping
meta_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against top-level schema properties. Refer to the section below on meta automated mappings.

field_meta_mapping.title: Field Meta Mapping
field_meta_mapping.description: mapping rules that will be executed against field-level schema properties. Refer to the section below on meta automated mappings.

strip_user_ids_from_email.title: Strip User Ids From Email
strip_user_ids_from_email.description: Whether or not to strip email id while adding owners using meta mappings.

tag_prefix.title: Tag Prefix
tag_prefix.description: Prefix added to tags during ingestion.

ignore_warnings_on_schema_type.title: Ignore Warnings On Schema Type
ignore_warnings_on_schema_type.description: Disables warnings reported for non-AVRO/Protobuf value or key schemas if set.

disable_topic_record_naming_strategy.title: Disable Topic Record Naming Strategy
disable_topic_record_naming_strategy.description: Disables the utilization of the TopicRecordNameStrategy for Schema Registry subjects. For more information, visit: https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/schema-registry/serdes-develop/index.html#handling-differences-between-preregistered-and-client-derived-schemas:~:text=io.confluent.kafka.serializers.subject.TopicRecordNameStrategy

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the state provider to use. For DataHub use `datahub`

config.title: Config
config.description: The configuration required for initializing the state provider. Default: The datahub_api config if set at pipeline level. Otherwise, the default DatahubClientConfig. See the defaults (https://github.com/datahub-project/datahub/blob/master/metadata-ingestion/src/datahub/ingestion/graph/client.py#L19).

StatefulStaleMetadataRemovalConfig.title: StatefulStaleMetadataRemovalConfig
StatefulStaleMetadataRemovalConfig.description: Base specialized config for Stateful Ingestion with stale metadata removal capability.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether or not to enable stateful ingest. Default: True if a pipeline_name is set and either a datahub-rest sink or `datahub_api` is specified, otherwise False

remove_stale_metadata.title: Remove Stale Metadata
remove_stale_metadata.description: Soft-deletes the entities present in the last successful run but missing in the current run with stateful_ingestion enabled.

AllowDenyPattern.title: AllowDenyPattern
AllowDenyPattern.description: A class to store allow deny regexes

allow.title: Allow
allow.description: List of regex patterns to include in ingestion

deny.title: Deny
deny.description: List of regex patterns to exclude from ingestion.

ignoreCase.title: Ignorecase
ignoreCase.description: Whether to ignore case sensitivity during pattern matching.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of the classifier to use. For DataHub,  use `datahub`

config.title: Config
config.description: The configuration required for initializing the classifier. If not specified, uses defaults for classifer type.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether classification should be used to auto-detect glossary terms

sample_size.title: Sample Size
sample_size.description: Number of sample values used for classification.

max_workers.title: Max Workers
max_workers.description: Number of worker processes to use for classification. Set to 1 to disable.

table_pattern.title: Table Pattern
table_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables for classification. This is used in combination with other patterns in parent config. Specify regex to match the entire table name in `database.schema.table` format. e.g. to match all tables starting with customer in Customer database and public schema, use the regex 'Customer.public.customer.*'

column_pattern.title: Column Pattern
column_pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter columns for classification. This is used in combination with other patterns in parent config. Specify regex to match the column name in `database.schema.table.column` format.

info_type_to_term.title: Info Type To Term
info_type_to_term.description: Optional mapping to provide glossary term identifier for info type

classifiers.title: Classifiers
classifiers.description: Classifiers to use to auto-detect glossary terms. If more than one classifier, infotype predictions from the classifier defined later in sequence take precedance.

lower_freq_profile_enabled.title: Lower Freq Profile Enabled
lower_freq_profile_enabled.description: Whether to do profiling at lower freq or not. This does not do any scheduling just adds additional checks to when not to run profiling.

profile_day_of_week.title: Profile Day Of Week
profile_day_of_week.description: Number between 0 to 6 for day of week (both inclusive). 0 is Monday and 6 is Sunday. If not specified, defaults to Nothing and this field does not take affect.

profile_date_of_month.title: Profile Date Of Month
profile_date_of_month.description: Number between 1 to 31 for date of month (both inclusive). If not specified, defaults to Nothing and this field does not take affect.

operation_config.title: Operation Config
operation_config.description: Experimental feature. To specify operation configs.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Max number of documents to profile. By default, profiles all documents.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Offset in documents to profile. By default, uses no offset.

report_dropped_profiles.title: Report Dropped Profiles
report_dropped_profiles.description: Whether to report datasets or dataset columns which were not profiled. Set to `True` for debugging purposes.

turn_off_expensive_profiling_metrics.title: Turn Off Expensive Profiling Metrics
turn_off_expensive_profiling_metrics.description: Whether to turn off expensive profiling or not. This turns off profiling for quantiles, distinct_value_frequencies, histogram & sample_values. This also limits maximum number of fields being profiled to 10.

profile_table_level_only.title: Profile Table Level Only
profile_table_level_only.description: Whether to perform profiling at table-level only, or include column-level profiling as well.

include_field_null_count.title: Include Field Null Count
include_field_null_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of nulls for each column.

include_field_distinct_count.title: Include Field Distinct Count
include_field_distinct_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of distinct values for each column.

include_field_min_value.title: Include Field Min Value
include_field_min_value.description: Whether to profile for the min value of numeric columns.

include_field_max_value.title: Include Field Max Value
include_field_max_value.description: Whether to profile for the max value of numeric columns.

include_field_mean_value.title: Include Field Mean Value
include_field_mean_value.description: Whether to profile for the mean value of numeric columns.

include_field_median_value.title: Include Field Median Value
include_field_median_value.description: Whether to profile for the median value of numeric columns.

include_field_stddev_value.title: Include Field Stddev Value
include_field_stddev_value.description: Whether to profile for the standard deviation of numeric columns.

include_field_quantiles.title: Include Field Quantiles
include_field_quantiles.description: Whether to profile for the quantiles of numeric columns.

include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.title: Include Field Distinct Value Frequencies
include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.description: Whether to profile for distinct value frequencies.

include_field_histogram.title: Include Field Histogram
include_field_histogram.description: Whether to profile for the histogram for numeric fields.

include_field_sample_values.title: Include Field Sample Values
include_field_sample_values.description: Whether to profile for the sample values for all columns.

field_sample_values_limit.title: Field Sample Values Limit
field_sample_values_limit.description: Upper limit for number of sample values to collect for all columns.

max_number_of_fields_to_profile.title: Max Number Of Fields To Profile
max_number_of_fields_to_profile.description: A positive integer that specifies the maximum number of columns to profile for any table. `None` implies all columns. The cost of profiling goes up significantly as the number of columns to profile goes up.

profile_if_updated_since_days.title: Profile If Updated Since Days
profile_if_updated_since_days.description: Profile table only if it has been updated since these many number of days. If set to `null`, no constraint of last modified time for tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`.

profile_table_size_limit.title: Profile Table Size Limit
profile_table_size_limit.description: Profile tables only if their size is less then specified GBs. If set to `null`, no limit on the size of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

profile_table_row_limit.title: Profile Table Row Limit
profile_table_row_limit.description: Profile tables only if their row count is less then specified count. If set to `null`, no limit on the row count of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

profile_table_row_count_estimate_only.title: Profile Table Row Count Estimate Only
profile_table_row_count_estimate_only.description: Use an approximate query for row count. This will be much faster but slightly less accurate. Only supported for Postgres and MySQL.

max_workers.title: Max Workers
max_workers.description: Number of worker threads to use for profiling. Set to 1 to disable.

query_combiner_enabled.title: Query Combiner Enabled
query_combiner_enabled.description: *This feature is still experimental and can be disabled if it causes issues.* Reduces the total number of queries issued and speeds up profiling by dynamically combining SQL queries where possible.

partition_profiling_enabled.title: Partition Profiling Enabled
partition_profiling_enabled.description: Whether to profile partitioned tables. Only BigQuery and Aws Athena supports this. If enabled, latest partition data is used for profiling.

partition_datetime.title: Partition Datetime
partition_datetime.description: If specified, profile only the partition which matches this datetime. If not specified, profile the latest partition. Only Bigquery supports this.

use_sampling.title: Use Sampling
use_sampling.description: Whether to profile column level stats on sample of table. Only BigQuery and Snowflake support this. If enabled, profiling is done on rows sampled from table. Sampling is not done for smaller tables.

sample_size.title: Sample Size
sample_size.description: Number of rows to be sampled from table for column level profiling.Applicable only if `use_sampling` is set to True.

profile_external_tables.title: Profile External Tables
profile_external_tables.description: Whether to profile external tables. Only Snowflake and Redshift supports this.

tags_to_ignore_sampling.title: Tags To Ignore Sampling
tags_to_ignore_sampling.description: Fixed list of tags to ignore sampling. If not specified, tables will be sampled based on `use_sampling`.

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`). You can also specify relative time with respect to end_time such as '-7 days' Or '-7d'.

top_n_queries.title: Top N Queries
top_n_queries.description: Number of top queries to save to each table.

user_email_pattern.title: User Email Pattern
user_email_pattern.description: regex patterns for user emails to filter in usage.

include_read_operational_stats.title: Include Read Operational Stats
include_read_operational_stats.description: Whether to report read operational stats. Experimental.

project_id.title: Project Id
project_id.description: Project id to set the credentials

private_key.title: Private Key
private_key.description:
Private key in a form of '-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
private-key
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----
'

client_x509_cert_url.title: Client X509 Cert Url
client_x509_cert_url.description: If not set it will be default to https://www.googleapis.com/robot/v1/metadata/x509/client_email

bucket_duration.description: Size of the time window to aggregate usage stats.

end_time.title: End Time
end_time.description: Latest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Current time in UTC

start_time.title: Start Time
start_time.description: Earliest date of lineage/usage to consider. Default: Last full day in UTC (or hour, depending on `bucket_duration`). You can also specify relative time with respect to end_time such as '-7 days' Or '-7d'.

top_n_queries.title: Top N Queries
top_n_queries.description: Number of top queries to save to each table.

user_email_pattern.title: User Email Pattern
user_email_pattern.description: regex patterns for user emails to filter in usage.

include_read_operational_stats.title: Include Read Operational Stats
include_read_operational_stats.description: Whether to report read operational stats. Experimental.

max_query_duration.title: Max Query Duration
max_query_duration.description: Correction to pad start_time and end_time with. For handling the case where the read happens within our time range but the query completion event is delayed and happens after the configured end time.

apply_view_usage_to_tables.title: Apply View Usage To Tables
apply_view_usage_to_tables.description: Whether to apply view's usage to its base tables. If set to False, uses sql parser and applies usage to views / tables mentioned in the query. If set to True, usage is applied to base tables only.

PlatformDetail.title: PlatformDetail
PlatformDetail.description: Any source that connects to a platform should inherit this class

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by this connector belong to

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: The instance of the platform that all assets produced by this recipe belong to. This should be unique within the platform. See https://datahubproject.io/docs/platform-instances/ for more details.

DataBricksPlatformDetail.title: DataBricksPlatformDetail
DataBricksPlatformDetail.description: metastore is an additional field used in Databricks connector to generate the dataset urn

platform_instance.title: Platform Instance
platform_instance.description: DataHub platform instance name. To generate correct urn for upstream dataset, this should match with platform instance name used in ingestion recipe of other datahub sources.

env.title: Env
env.description: The environment that all assets produced by DataHub platform ingestion source belong to

create_corp_user.title: Create Corp User
create_corp_user.description: Whether ingest PowerBI user as Datahub Corpuser

use_powerbi_email.title: Use Powerbi Email
use_powerbi_email.description: Use PowerBI User email to ingest as corpuser, default is powerbi user identifier

remove_email_suffix.title: Remove Email Suffix
remove_email_suffix.description: Remove PowerBI User email suffix for example, @acryl.io

dataset_configured_by_as_owner.title: Dataset Configured By As Owner
dataset_configured_by_as_owner.description: Take PBI dataset configuredBy as dataset owner if exist

owner_criteria.title: Owner Criteria
owner_criteria.description: Need to have certain authority to qualify as owner for example ['ReadWriteReshareExplore','Owner','Admin']

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether profiling of PowerBI datasets should be done

platform_override_map.title: Platform Override Map
platform_override_map.description: A holder for platform -> platform mappings to generate correct dataset urns

database_override_map.title: Database Override Map
database_override_map.description: A holder for database -> database mappings to generate correct dataset urns

key.title: Key
key.description: The key to sort on. This can be a compound key based on the path_spec variables.

type.description: The date format to use when sorting. This is used to parse the date from the key. The format should follow the java [SimpleDateFormat](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html) format.

date_format.title: Date Format
date_format.description: The date format to use when sorting. This is used to parse the date from the key. The format should follow the java [SimpleDateFormat](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html) format.

include.title: Include
include.description: Path to table. Name variable `{table}` is used to mark the folder with dataset. In absence of `{table}`, file level dataset will be created. Check below examples for more details.

exclude.title: Exclude
exclude.description: list of paths in glob pattern which will be excluded while scanning for the datasets

file_types.title: File Types
file_types.description: Files with extenstions specified here (subset of default value) only will be scanned to create dataset. Other files will be omitted.

default_extension.title: Default Extension
default_extension.description: For files without extension it will assume the specified file type. If it is not set the files without extensions will be skipped.

table_name.title: Table Name
table_name.description: Display name of the dataset.Combination of named variables from include path and strings

enable_compression.title: Enable Compression
enable_compression.description: Enable or disable processing compressed files. Currently .gz and .bz files are supported.

sample_files.title: Sample Files
sample_files.description: Not listing all the files but only taking a handful amount of sample file to infer the schema. File count and file size calculation will be disabled. This can affect performance significantly if enabled

allow_double_stars.title: Allow Double Stars
allow_double_stars.description: Allow double stars in the include path. This can affect performance significantly if enabled

autodetect_partitions.title: Autodetect Partitions
autodetect_partitions.description: Autodetect partition(s) from the path. If set to true, it will autodetect partition key/value if the folder format is {partition_key}={partition_value} for example `year=2024`

traversal_method.description: Method to traverse the folder. ALL: Traverse all the folders, MIN_MAX: Traverse the folders by finding min and max value, MAX: Traverse the folder with max value

include_hidden_folders.title: Include Hidden Folders
include_hidden_folders.description: Include hidden folders in the traversal (folders starting with . or _

StatefulIngestionConfig.title: StatefulIngestionConfig
StatefulIngestionConfig.description: Basic Stateful Ingestion Specific Configuration for any source.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether or not to enable stateful ingest. Default: True if a pipeline_name is set and either a datahub-rest sink or `datahub_api` is specified, otherwise False

EmitDirective.title: EmitDirective
EmitDirective.description: A holder for directives for emission for specific types of entities

DBTEntitiesEnabled.description: Controls which dbt entities are going to be emitted by this source

models.description: Emit metadata for dbt models when set to Yes or Only

seeds.description: Emit metadata for dbt seeds when set to Yes or Only

RoleArn.title: Rolearn
RoleArn.description: ARN of the role to assume.

ExternalId.title: Externalid
ExternalId.description: External ID to use when assuming the role.

AwsConnectionConfig.title: AwsConnectionConfig
AwsConnectionConfig.description:
Common AWS credentials config.

Currently used by:
    - Glue source
    - SageMaker source
    - dbt source

aws_access_key_id.title: Aws Access Key Id
aws_access_key_id.description: AWS access key ID. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_secret_access_key.title: Aws Secret Access Key
aws_secret_access_key.description: AWS secret access key. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_session_token.title: Aws Session Token
aws_session_token.description: AWS session token. Can be auto-detected, see [the AWS boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/credentials.html) for details.

aws_role.title: Aws Role
aws_role.description: AWS roles to assume. If using the string format, the role ARN can be specified directly. If using the object format, the role can be specified in the RoleArn field and additional available arguments are the same as [boto3's STS.Client.assume_role](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/sts.html?highlight=assume_role#STS.Client.assume_role).

aws_profile.title: Aws Profile
aws_profile.description: Named AWS profile to use. Only used if access key / secret are unset. If not set the default will be used

aws_endpoint_url.title: Aws Endpoint Url
aws_endpoint_url.description: The AWS service endpoint. This is normally [constructed automatically](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/core/session.html), but can be overridden here.

aws_proxy.title: Aws Proxy
aws_proxy.description: A set of proxy configs to use with AWS. See the [botocore.config](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html) docs for details.

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout for reading from the connection (in seconds).

aws_advanced_config.title: Aws Advanced Config
aws_advanced_config.description: Advanced AWS configuration options. These are passed directly to [botocore.config.Config](https://botocore.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/config.html).

GitReference.title: GitReference
GitReference.description: Reference to a hosted Git repository. Used to generate "view source" links.

repo.title: Repo
repo.description: Name of your Git repo e.g. https://github.com/datahub-project/datahub or https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab. If organization/repo is provided, we assume it is a GitHub repo.

branch.title: Branch
branch.description: Branch on which your files live by default. Typically main or master. This can also be a commit hash.

url_template.title: Url Template
url_template.description: Template for generating a URL to a file in the repo e.g. '{repo_url}/blob/{branch}/{file_path}'. We can infer this for GitHub and GitLab repos, and it is otherwise required.It supports the following variables: {repo_url}, {branch}, {file_path}

operation_config.title: Operation Config
operation_config.description: Experimental feature. To specify operation configs.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Max number of documents to profile. By default, profiles all documents.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Offset in documents to profile. By default, uses no offset.

report_dropped_profiles.title: Report Dropped Profiles
report_dropped_profiles.description: Whether to report datasets or dataset columns which were not profiled. Set to `True` for debugging purposes.

turn_off_expensive_profiling_metrics.title: Turn Off Expensive Profiling Metrics
turn_off_expensive_profiling_metrics.description: Whether to turn off expensive profiling or not. This turns off profiling for quantiles, distinct_value_frequencies, histogram & sample_values. This also limits maximum number of fields being profiled to 10.

profile_table_level_only.title: Profile Table Level Only
profile_table_level_only.description: Whether to perform profiling at table-level only, or include column-level profiling as well.

include_field_null_count.title: Include Field Null Count
include_field_null_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of nulls for each column.

include_field_distinct_count.title: Include Field Distinct Count
include_field_distinct_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of distinct values for each column.

include_field_min_value.title: Include Field Min Value
include_field_min_value.description: Whether to profile for the min value of numeric columns.

include_field_max_value.title: Include Field Max Value
include_field_max_value.description: Whether to profile for the max value of numeric columns.

include_field_mean_value.title: Include Field Mean Value
include_field_mean_value.description: Whether to profile for the mean value of numeric columns.

include_field_median_value.title: Include Field Median Value
include_field_median_value.description: Whether to profile for the median value of numeric columns.

include_field_stddev_value.title: Include Field Stddev Value
include_field_stddev_value.description: Whether to profile for the standard deviation of numeric columns.

include_field_quantiles.title: Include Field Quantiles
include_field_quantiles.description: Whether to profile for the quantiles of numeric columns.

include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.title: Include Field Distinct Value Frequencies
include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.description: Whether to profile for distinct value frequencies.

include_field_histogram.title: Include Field Histogram
include_field_histogram.description: Whether to profile for the histogram for numeric fields.

include_field_sample_values.title: Include Field Sample Values
include_field_sample_values.description: Whether to profile for the sample values for all columns.

field_sample_values_limit.title: Field Sample Values Limit
field_sample_values_limit.description: Upper limit for number of sample values to collect for all columns.

max_number_of_fields_to_profile.title: Max Number Of Fields To Profile
max_number_of_fields_to_profile.description: A positive integer that specifies the maximum number of columns to profile for any table. `None` implies all columns. The cost of profiling goes up significantly as the number of columns to profile goes up.

profile_if_updated_since_days.title: Profile If Updated Since Days
profile_if_updated_since_days.description: Profile table only if it has been updated since these many number of days. If set to `null`, no constraint of last modified time for tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`.

profile_table_size_limit.title: Profile Table Size Limit
profile_table_size_limit.description: Profile tables only if their size is less then specified GBs. If set to `null`, no limit on the size of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

profile_table_row_limit.title: Profile Table Row Limit
profile_table_row_limit.description: Profile tables only if their row count is less then specified count. If set to `null`, no limit on the row count of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

profile_table_row_count_estimate_only.title: Profile Table Row Count Estimate Only
profile_table_row_count_estimate_only.description: Use an approximate query for row count. This will be much faster but slightly less accurate. Only supported for Postgres and MySQL.

max_workers.title: Max Workers
max_workers.description: Number of worker threads to use for profiling. Set to 1 to disable.

query_combiner_enabled.title: Query Combiner Enabled
query_combiner_enabled.description: *This feature is still experimental and can be disabled if it causes issues.* Reduces the total number of queries issued and speeds up profiling by dynamically combining SQL queries where possible.

partition_profiling_enabled.title: Partition Profiling Enabled
partition_profiling_enabled.description: Enable partition profiling. This will profile the latest partition of the table.

partition_datetime.title: Partition Datetime
partition_datetime.description: If specified, profile only the partition which matches this datetime. If not specified, profile the latest partition. Only Bigquery supports this.

use_sampling.title: Use Sampling
use_sampling.description: Whether to profile column level stats on sample of table. Only BigQuery and Snowflake support this. If enabled, profiling is done on rows sampled from table. Sampling is not done for smaller tables.

sample_size.title: Sample Size
sample_size.description: Number of rows to be sampled from table for column level profiling.Applicable only if `use_sampling` is set to True.

profile_external_tables.title: Profile External Tables
profile_external_tables.description: Whether to profile external tables. Only Snowflake and Redshift supports this.

tags_to_ignore_sampling.title: Tags To Ignore Sampling
tags_to_ignore_sampling.description: Fixed list of tags to ignore sampling. If not specified, tables will be sampled based on `use_sampling`.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs.

private_key.title: Private Key
private_key.description:
Private key in a form of '-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
private-key
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----
' if using key pair authentication. Encrypted version of private key will be in a form of '-----BEGIN ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----
encrypted-private-key
-----END ENCRYPTED PRIVATE KEY-----
' See: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/key-pair-auth.html

private_key_path.title: Private Key Path
private_key_path.description: The path to the private key if using key pair authentication. Ignored if `private_key` is set. See: https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/key-pair-auth.html

private_key_password.title: Private Key Password
private_key_password.description: Password for your private key. Required if using key pair authentication with encrypted private key.

authentication_type.title: Authentication Type
authentication_type.description: The type of authenticator to use when connecting to Snowflake. Supports "DEFAULT_AUTHENTICATOR", "OAUTH_AUTHENTICATOR", "EXTERNAL_BROWSER_AUTHENTICATOR" and "KEY_PAIR_AUTHENTICATOR".

account_id.title: Account Id
account_id.description: Snowflake account identifier. e.g. xy12345,  xy12345.us-east-2.aws, xy12345.us-central1.gcp, xy12345.central-us.azure, xy12345.us-west-2.privatelink. Refer [Account Identifiers](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/admin-account-identifier.html#format-2-legacy-account-locator-in-a-region) for more details.

connect_args.title: Connect Args
connect_args.description: Connect args to pass to Snowflake SqlAlchemy driver

extra_client_options.title: Extra Client Options
extra_client_options.description: Additional options to pass to google.cloud.logging_v2.client.Client.

project_on_behalf.title: Project On Behalf
project_on_behalf.description: [Advanced] The BigQuery project in which queries are executed. Will be passed when creating a job. If not passed, falls back to the project associated with the service account.

destination_platform.title: Destination Platform
destination_platform.description: The destination platform where fivetran connector log tables are dumped.

snowflake_destination_config.title: Snowflake Destination Config
snowflake_destination_config.description: If destination platform is 'snowflake', provide snowflake configuration.

bigquery_destination_config.title: Bigquery Destination Config
bigquery_destination_config.description: If destination platform is 'bigquery', provide bigquery configuration.

strip_urls.description: Strip filename from s3 url. It only applies if path_specs are not specified.

ignore_non_path_spec_path.title: Ignore Non Path Spec Path
ignore_non_path_spec_path.description: Ignore paths that are not match in path_specs. It only applies if path_specs are specified.

enabled.title: Enabled

operation_config.title: Operation Config
operation_config.description: Experimental feature. To specify operation configs.

urns_suffix_regex.title: Urns Suffix Regex
urns_suffix_regex.description:
List of regex patterns to remove from the name of the URN. All of the indices before removal of URNs are considered as the same dataset. These are applied in order for each URN.
        The main case where you would want to have multiple of these if the name where you are trying to remove suffix from have different formats.
        e.g. ending with -YYYY-MM-DD as well as ending -epochtime would require you to have 2 regex patterns to remove the suffixes across all URNs.

include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.description: Whether to profile for distinct value frequencies.

profile_if_updated_since_days.title: Profile If Updated Since Days
profile_if_updated_since_days.description: Profile table only if it has been updated since these many number of days. If set to `null`, no constraint of last modified time for tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`.

profile_table_size_limit.title: Profile Table Size Limit
profile_table_size_limit.description: Profile tables only if their size is less then specified GBs. If set to `null`, no limit on the size of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

profile_table_row_limit.title: Profile Table Row Limit
profile_table_row_limit.description: Profile tables only if their row count is less then specified count. If set to `null`, no limit on the row count of tables to profile. Supported only in `snowflake` and `BigQuery`

profile_table_row_count_estimate_only.title: Profile Table Row Count Estimate Only
profile_table_row_count_estimate_only.description: Use an approximate query for row count. This will be much faster but slightly less accurate. Only supported for Postgres and MySQL.

max_workers.title: Max Workers
max_workers.description: Number of worker threads to use for profiling. Set to 1 to disable.

query_combiner_enabled.title: Query Combiner Enabled
query_combiner_enabled.description: *This feature is still experimental and can be disabled if it causes issues.* Reduces the total number of queries issued and speeds up profiling by dynamically combining SQL queries where possible.

partition_profiling_enabled.title: Partition Profiling Enabled
partition_profiling_enabled.description: Whether to profile partitioned tables. Only BigQuery and Aws Athena supports this. If enabled, latest partition data is used for profiling.

partition_datetime.title: Partition Datetime
partition_datetime.description: If specified, profile only the partition which matches this datetime. If not specified, profile the latest partition. Only Bigquery supports this.

use_sampling.title: Use Sampling
use_sampling.description: Whether to profile column level stats on sample of table. Only BigQuery and Snowflake support this. If enabled, profiling is done on rows sampled from table. Sampling is not done for smaller tables.

sample_size.title: Sample Size
sample_size.description: Number of rows to be sampled from table for column level profiling.Applicable only if `use_sampling` is set to True.

profile_external_tables.title: Profile External Tables
profile_external_tables.description: Whether to profile external tables. Only Snowflake and Redshift supports this.

tags_to_ignore_sampling.title: Tags To Ignore Sampling
tags_to_ignore_sampling.description: Fixed list of tags to ignore sampling. If not specified, tables will be sampled based on `use_sampling`.

pattern.description: Regex patterns to filter tables for profiling during ingestion. Specify regex to match the `catalog.schema.table` format. Note that only tables allowed by the `table_pattern` will be considered.

max_wait_secs.title: Max Wait Secs
max_wait_secs.description: Maximum time to wait for a table to be profiled.

connector_platform.description: A connector's actual platform name. If not provided, will take from metadata tablesEg: hive catalog can have a connector platform as 'hive' or 'glue' or some other metastore.

enabled.title: Enabled

operation_config.description: Experimental feature. To specify operation configs.

GitInfo.title: GitInfo
GitInfo.description: A reference to a Git repository, including a deploy key that can be used to clone it.

repo.title: Repo
repo.description: Name of your Git repo e.g. https://github.com/datahub-project/datahub or https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab. If organization/repo is provided, we assume it is a GitHub repo.

branch.title: Branch
branch.description: Branch on which your files live by default. Typically main or master. This can also be a commit hash.

url_template.title: Url Template
url_template.description: Template for generating a URL to a file in the repo e.g. '{repo_url}/blob/{branch}/{file_path}'. We can infer this for GitHub and GitLab repos, and it is otherwise required.It supports the following variables: {repo_url}, {branch}, {file_path}

deploy_key_file.title: Deploy Key File
deploy_key_file.description: A private key file that contains an ssh key that has been configured as a deploy key for this repository. Use a file where possible, else see deploy_key for a config field that accepts a raw string. We expect the key not have a passphrase.

deploy_key.title: Deploy Key
deploy_key.description: A private key that contains an ssh key that has been configured as a deploy key for this repository. See deploy_key_file if you want to use a file that contains this key.

repo_ssh_locator.title: Repo Ssh Locator
repo_ssh_locator.description: The url to call `git clone` on. We infer this for github and gitlab repos, but it is required for other hosts.

platform_env.title: Platform Env
platform_env.description: The environment that the platform is located in. Leaving this empty will inherit defaults from the top level Looker configuration

base_url.title: Base Url
base_url.description: Url to your Looker instance: `https://company.looker.com:19999` or `https://looker.company.com`, or similar. Used for making API calls to Looker and constructing clickable dashboard and chart urls.

column_count.description: The parameter name for column count in glue table.

null_count.title: Null Count
null_count.description: The parameter name for the count of null values in a column.

null_proportion.description: The parameter name for the proportion of null values in a column.

stdev.title: Stdev

partition_patterns.title: Partition Patterns
partition_patterns.description: Regex patterns for filtering partitions for profile. The pattern should be a string like: "{'key':'value'}".

operation_config.title: Operation Config
operation_config.description: Experimental feature. To specify operation configs.

retry_backoff_multiplier.title: Retry Backoff Multiplier
retry_backoff_multiplier.description: Multiplier for exponential backoff when waiting to retry

max_retry_interval.title: Max Retry Interval
max_retry_interval.description: Maximum interval to wait when retrying

max_attempts.title: Max Attempts
max_attempts.description: Maximum number of attempts to retry before failing

sqlalchemy_uri.description: URI of database to connect to. See https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#database-urls. Takes precedence over other connection parameters.

options.title: Options
options.description: Any options specified here will be passed to [SQLAlchemy.create_engine](https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/core/engines.html#sqlalchemy.create_engine) as kwargs. To set connection arguments in the URL, specify them under `connect_args`.

KafkaConsumerConnectionConfig.description: Configuration class for holding connectivity information for Kafka consumers

schema_registry_config.description: Extra schema registry config serialized as JSON. These options will be passed into Kafka's SchemaRegistryClient. https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/clients/confluent-kafka-python/html/index.html?#schemaregistryclient

client_timeout_seconds.title: Client Timeout Seconds
client_timeout_seconds.description: The request timeout used when interacting with the Kafka APIs.

consumer_config.title: Consumer Config
consumer_config.description: Extra consumer config serialized as JSON. These options will be passed into Kafka's DeserializingConsumer. See https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/clients/confluent-kafka-python/html/index.html#deserializingconsumer and https://github.com/edenhill/librdkafka/blob/master/CONFIGURATION.md .

base_path.title: Base Path
base_path.description: Base folder in hierarchical namespaces to start from.

account_name.title: Account Name
account_name.description: Name of the Azure storage account.  See [Microsoft official documentation on how to create a storage account.](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/create-data-lake-storage-account)

account_key.title: Account Key
account_key.description: Azure storage account access key that can be used as a credential. **An account key, a SAS token or a client secret is required for authentication.**

sas_token.title: Sas Token
sas_token.description: Azure storage account Shared Access Signature (SAS) token that can be used as a credential. **An account key, a SAS token or a client secret is required for authentication.**

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: Azure client secret that can be used as a credential. **An account key, a SAS token or a client secret is required for authentication.**

client_id.title: Client Id
client_id.description: Azure client (Application) ID required when a `client_secret` is used as a credential.

tenant_id.title: Tenant Id
tenant_id.description: Azure tenant (Directory) ID required when a `client_secret` is used as a credential.

operation_config.title: Operation Config
operation_config.description: Experimental feature. To specify operation configs.

profile_table_level_only.title: Profile Table Level Only
profile_table_level_only.description: Whether to perform profiling at table-level only or include column-level profiling as well.

max_number_of_fields_to_profile.title: Max Number Of Fields To Profile
max_number_of_fields_to_profile.description: A positive integer that specifies the maximum number of columns to profile for any table. `None` implies all columns. The cost of profiling goes up significantly as the number of columns to profile goes up.

include_field_null_count.title: Include Field Null Count
include_field_null_count.description: Whether to profile for the number of nulls for each column.

include_field_min_value.title: Include Field Min Value
include_field_min_value.description: Whether to profile for the min value of numeric columns.

include_field_max_value.title: Include Field Max Value
include_field_max_value.description: Whether to profile for the max value of numeric columns.

include_field_mean_value.title: Include Field Mean Value
include_field_mean_value.description: Whether to profile for the mean value of numeric columns.

include_field_median_value.title: Include Field Median Value
include_field_median_value.description: Whether to profile for the median value of numeric columns.

include_field_stddev_value.title: Include Field Stddev Value
include_field_stddev_value.description: Whether to profile for the standard deviation of numeric columns.

include_field_quantiles.title: Include Field Quantiles
include_field_quantiles.description: Whether to profile for the quantiles of numeric columns.

include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.title: Include Field Distinct Value Frequencies
include_field_distinct_value_frequencies.description: Whether to profile for distinct value frequencies.

include_field_histogram.title: Include Field Histogram
include_field_histogram.description: Whether to profile for the histogram for numeric fields.

include_field_sample_values.title: Include Field Sample Values
include_field_sample_values.description: Whether to profile for the sample values for all columns.

match.title: Match
match.description: Pattern to match on uri-s as part of reference resolution. See replace field

replace.title: Replace
replace.description: Pattern to replace with as part of reference resolution. See match field

use_s3_bucket_tags.title: Use S3 Bucket Tags
use_s3_bucket_tags.description: Whether or not to create tags in datahub from the s3 bucket

use_s3_object_tags.title: Use S3 Object Tags
use_s3_object_tags.description: # Whether or not to create tags in datahub from the s3 object
